title: THESIS - Potential of hydrogen production with off-shore wind in Sweden and Finland
description:
**Background**
 The transition to renewable energy sources is crucial for achieving climate goals and reducing carbon emissions. Off-shore wind power is emerging as a significant player in the renewable energy sector due to its high capacity and reliability. Sweden aims to achieve fossil-free energy production by 2040, with a target of 120 TWh for offshore wind energy. Meanwhile, Finland is committed to attaining carbon neutrality by 2035 and is setting ambitious targets for off-shore wind power capacity. Hydrogen, a versatile and clean energy carrier produced through electrolysis, can address the intermittency of wind power and contribute to significant export possibilities for clean electricity derived products. Such approach also mitigates risks associated with wind investments.
   

  

**Purpose**
 The primary aim of this thesis project is to understand different potential project development setups in off-shore wind coupled with hydrogen production through electrolysis. This involves assessing the technical, economic, and environmental aspects of integrating off-shore wind energy with hydrogen production in Sweden and Finland.
   

  

 The first step is a detailed literature review to understand off-shore wind technology and project development in the Nordics. It will also cover hydrogen production in arctic conditions, looking at challenges and advancements. Additionally, infrastructure plans by transmission system operators (Svenska Kraftnät, Fingrid, Nordion Energi, and Gasgrid) will be reviewed.
   

  

 Following the literature review, a detailed techno-economic analysis will be conducted to understand how off-shore wind and hydrogen production can be best integrated. This analysis will consider several critical factors including but not limited to:
   

  

  

* Seasonality of off-shore wind power and how the electrolyser capacity should be dimensioned;
* Potential of curtailed wind power;
* Location of the electrolyser (off-shore vs. on-shore);
* Infrastructure requirements (electricity transmission and hydrogen pipeline).


 The thesis will provide valuable insights into the optimal integration of off-shore wind and hydrogen production in the Nordics. The findings will help in identifying best practices, potential challenges, and opportunities for further development in this field.
   

  

**WE OFFER**
 At Fortum, a thesis project is an excellent opportunity to engage with students and for you to understand how our company works. We also offer the possibility to work on very topical area and in the “forefront” of energy transition. You'll have a qualified internal supervisor and develop a network within and beyond Fortum, including other thesis students. When relevant, you'll also collaborate with external experts.
   

  

 Fortum offers a taxable one-time compensation for a well-executed and approved thesis.
   

  

**Your Qualifications**
 You are on the final stretch of a master's degree in a related field. You are likely analytical, self-driven, and goal-oriented as an individual. You thrive on challenges and are inspired by addressing and resolving new problems.
   

  

 Together, we will outline the scope to fit the requirements of a master's level thesis (30 credits). The thesis will need to be written in English.
   

  

**INTERESTED?**
 Submit your application through our recruitment page (https://www.fortum.se/om-oss/jobba-hos-oss/studenter/examensarbeten) with your CV and a cover letter (up to one A4 page). The cover letter should include a brief description of your motivation and interests.
   

  

 If you are applying as a pair, each applicant must submit their own application and specify in the cover letter the person they wish to collaborate with.
   

  

 Please label your application “Master thesis in offshore hydrogen production”. Apply
 **no later than 2024-11-24** 
 . We review applications continuously, and the position may be filled prior to the deadline.

title: Thesis project: 30 credits Soundscape Study of Scania Truck Cabins
description:
**Introduction**
 Engaging in a thesis project at Scania is a valuable opportunity to establish connections for your future career. Many of our current employees began their professional journeys with a thesis project, and we continue to seek partnerships with students and academic institutions.
   

  

**Background**
 Scania is committed to setting the benchmark for sustainable and comfortable vehicle solutions. The acoustic environment within truck cabins plays a crucial role in driver comfort, safety, and overall experience. As the automotive industry evolves, there is an increasing need for sophisticated soundscape analysis and design to create optimal acoustic environments for drivers. This master thesis project is derived from a joint research initiative between Scania and University College London (UCL), UK, further emphasizing Scania’s dedication to advancing acoustic solutions that align with its broader goals for vehicle comfort and sustainability.
   

  

**Objective**
 The goal of this thesis is to conduct a comprehensive soundscape study of Scania truck cabins, analyzing the current acoustic environment and proposing innovative solutions to enhance driver comfort and experience.
   

  

**Job Description**
 This thesis project offers flexibility and can be adapted to the student's interests while focusing on key objectives. The main tasks may include:
   

  

  

* Conducting in-depth acoustic measurements and analysis of various Scania truck cabin models under different driving conditions.
* Creating a soundscape mapping of truck cabins, identifying key sound sources and their contributions to the overall acoustic environment.
* Proposing and simulating innovative acoustic treatments and active noise control solutions to optimize the cabin soundscape.


**Education/program/focus** 
  

  

  

* Candidates with the following background and skills will be preferred:
+ Strong foundation in acoustics, psychoacoustics, sound design, or related fields, with relevant coursework or project experience.
+ Proficiency in acoustic measurement techniques and analysis software (e.g., PULSE, SoundCheck).
+ Experience with sound quality evaluation and psychoacoustic metrics.
+ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


 Number of students: 1
   

  

  

* Start date for the thesis work: January 2025 (flexible start date)
* Estimated time required: 20 weeks
* Note: If you currently live far from Stockholm/Södertälje, it might be possible to rent one of Scania’s furnished apartments in Södertälje for the duration of the thesis.


**Contact persons and supervisors**
 Naveen Indolia, Brand chief engineer ENXC, naveen.indolia@scania.com
   

  

 Zibo Liu, Development engineer ENXPS, zibo.liu@scania.com
   

  

 Jessica Hedstig, Group manager ENXPS, jessica.hedstig@scania.com
   

  

**Application:**
 Your application must include a CV, personal letter and transcript of grades
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position. We are conducting interviews continuously and may close the recruitment earlier than the date specified.

title: Thesis Project 30 hp - Non-Invasive methods to check engines for particles at Engine Assembly
description:
Scania is a leading global manufacturer of heavy trucks, buses, and engines for marine and industrial applications. Our variant, the Scania super engine, is the most fuel efficient engine in the market and thus, it has very high performance requirements. One of the critical areas in the engine assembly is ensuring the cleanliness and integrity of engine components, as particle residues can significantly affect engine performance and longevity.
   

  

 The assembly of Scania engines involves intricate and precise operations where each component must meet stringent quality standards. During the assembly process, even the smallest contamination from particles can lead to engine malfunction or failure. Traditionally, assembly crash routines to detect such contaminants have involved disassembling methods that can disrupt the assembly process, potentially leading to additional downtime and costs.
   

  

 To maintain its competitive edge and uphold its reputation for excellence, Scania is exploring innovative approaches to enhance its inspection . Thesis project at Scania is an excellent way of making contacts for your future working life. Many of our current employees started their career with a thesis project.
   

  

**Background:**
 The thesis will be conducted at the Scania engine assembly facility in Sodertalje. The objective is to explore and identify a non-invasive crash routine method for inspecting engines for particle residues, supplementing the primary Torque-to-Turn (TTT) test currently in use. In cases where the TTT test triggers an error alarm, there is a need for a rapid crash routine to determine whether the alarm is a false positive or if the engine should be removed from the line for scrapping by detecting the presence of particles inside the engine without performing disassembly i.e. non-invasively.
   

  

 The selected candidate will investigate existing methodologies, assess their effectiveness through practical testing, and propose innovative solutions tailored to Scania's engine assembly processes. The research will encompass a combination of theoretical study, practical experimentation, and close collaboration with Scania’s process engineering and quality assurance teams.
   

  

**Target:**
 The aim of this thesis project is to develop a non-invasive crash routine method for inspecting engines for particle residues during assembly. This method will supplement the existing Torque-to-Turn (TTT) test, enabling rapid verification of error alarms to determine if they are false positives or if the engine needs to be removed from the line for further inspection.
   

  

**Assignment:**
* Conduct a comprehensive literature review on non-invasive inspection methods for particle detection in mechanical assemblies.
* Analyse current inspection processes at Scania and identify where and how the non-invasive methods could be integrated.
* Design and implement experimental setups to test various non-invasive inspection techniques.
* Evaluate the feasibility, accuracy, and efficiency of these techniques in detecting particle residues in assembled engines.
* Collaborate with the process engineering team to align the research with real-world assembly conditions and requirements.
* Develop detailed documentation and present findings, including practical recommendations for implementing the identified methods.


**Education:**
 Master's program in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, or a related field.
   

  

 Number of students: 2
   

  

 Start date: Jan 2025
   

  

 Estimated time needed: 20 weeks (30 hp)
   

  

**Contact persons and supervisors:**
 Aravind Ram Seshadri, Data Analyst, Process Engineering Backoffice, DETS, E-mail: aravind.ram.seshadri@scania.com, Telephone: +46 72 775 2577
   

  

 Anna Granqvist, Head of Process Engineering Backoffice, DETS, E-mail: anna.granqvist@scania.com, Telephone: +46 70 081 34 04
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should contain a covering letter, CV and transcripts.
   

  

 Selections will be made throughout the application period.
   

  

**A background check might be conducted for this position. We are conducting interviews continuously and may close the recruitment earlier than the date specified.**

title: Thesis Project: 30 credits 30 hp - CFD simulations in exhaust aftertreatment systems

title: THESIS - Current status and outlooks of hydrogen mobility market in Sweden and Finland
description:
**Background**
 Hydrogen mobility is a crucial element in the broader energy transition, aiming to cut greenhouse gas emissions and foster sustainable development. As a clean energy carrier, hydrogen can be derived from multiple renewable sources such as wind, solar, and hydropower through electrolysis. This flexibility makes it an appealing choice for decarbonizing sectors that are difficult to electrify, like heavy transport and industry. Within the framework of the energy transition, hydrogen-fueled vehicles—cars, buses, trucks, and trains—present a promising alternative to their fossil fuel counterparts. By employing hydrogen fuel cells, these vehicles emit only water vapor, thereby contributing to cleaner air and reducing dependence on petroleum. Integrating hydrogen mobility into the energy system is vital for meeting climate targets, improving energy security, and stimulating technological advances in both automotive and energy industries.
   

  

**Purpose**
 The thesis will focus on understanding the market aspects of the hydrogen mobility sector in Sweden and Finland by conducting a comprehensive literature study alongside interviews with key market players. The research aims to assess the market maturity and identify the factors driving the willingness to pay for hydrogen mobility solutions. By exploring these elements, the thesis seeks to uncover the motivations behind the adoption of hydrogen technologies and gauge the sector's readiness for broader implementation. Additionally, the study will delve into the sustainability impacts of hydrogen mobility, examining how it contributes to reducing carbon footprints and promoting the use of renewable energy sources.
   

  

 Part of the thesis will include a cost parity comparison between hydrogen mobility and other alternative options such as electric vehicles (EVs) and biodiesel. This comparison aims to evaluate the economic feasibility of hydrogen as a competitive alternative fuel. By doing so, the thesis will offer a holistic view of where hydrogen stands in relation to other green mobility solutions.
   

  

 This investigation will provide valuable insights into the economic, social, and environmental drivers that are essential for fostering the growth of hydrogen mobility in Sweden and Finland.
   

  

**WE OFFER**
 At Fortum, a thesis project is an excellent opportunity to engage with students and for you to understand how our company works. We also offer the possibility to work on very topical area and in the “forefront” of energy transition. You'll have a qualified internal supervisor and develop a network within and beyond Fortum, including other thesis students. When relevant, you'll also collaborate with external experts.
   

  

 Fortum offers a taxable one-time compensation for a well-executed and approved thesis.
   

  

**Your Qualifications**
 You are on the final stretch of a master's degree in a related field. You are likely analytical, self-driven, and goal-oriented as an individual. You thrive on challenges and are inspired by addressing and resolving new problems.
   

  

 Together, we will outline the scope to fit the requirements of a master's level thesis (30 credits). The thesis will need to be written in English.
   

  

**INTERESTED?**
 Submit your application through our recruitment page (https://www.fortum.se/om-oss/jobba-hos-oss/studenter/examensarbeten) with your CV and a cover letter (up to one A4 page). The cover letter should include a brief description of your motivation and interests.
   

  

 If you are applying as a pair, each applicant must submit their own application and specify in the cover letter the person they wish to collaborate with.
   

  

 Please label your application “Master thesis in hydrogen mobility”. Apply
 **no later than 2024-11-24** 
 . We review applications continuously, and the position may be filled prior to the deadline.

title: Testare till vårt Inhouse enhet, MyTeam!
description:
Vi på MyTeam söker nu efter en testare till vårt inhouse team i Göteborg. Är du redo för nya utmaningar och ser ett stark hopsvetsat team och nya spännande uppdrag som en del av din framtid, tveka inte att söka!

**Bakgrund**


På MyTeam har vi två centrala målsättningar; att leverera stabila lösningar som genererar nöjda kunder och att skapa trygga team med lyckliga medarbetare. Tack vare lång erfarenhet av att arbeta med systemförvaltning är de processer vi använder väl beprövade och framgångsrika, och underlättar för oss att göra lyckade kundanpassningar efter krav och önskemål.

**Hur ser rollen ut?**


Hos oss planerar du testarbetet och skriver testplaner, prioriterar, resurssäkrar testuppdraget samt följer upp och förbättrar testprocessen. Dessutom koordinerar du testarbetet samt sköter teamuppföljning.


Med dina kollegor på Nexer delar du kunskap och tillsammans bygger vi kompetens och tar oss an de stora utmaningarna. Att bygga och dela kompetens är viktigt för oss. Att gå kurser och ta certifieringar välkomnas alltid.

**Din bakgrund**


Du har arbetat några år med testautomatisering i större och mindre testprojekt. Vi tror att du har stor vana av agila tillvägagångssätt, till exempel Scrum och SAFe samt DevOps. Du är bekväm med följande verktyg:

* Selenium
* Cucumber
* Postman


Troligen är du utbildad systemvetare, ingenjör eller liknande. Vidare ser vi gärna att du har programmeringserfarenhet, t ex i JavaScript, Java och/eller C#


Dina personliga egenskaper är viktiga för oss då vill behålla den atmosfär vi har idag. Våra medarbetare kännetecknas av en affärsmässig och kundorienterad attityd, samt förmåga att snabbt ta till sig ny information och omvandla den till kreativa lösningar. Du respekterar dina kollegor och har en stark vilja att dela med dig av dina kunskaper till andra samt lyssna och lära.


Vi letar efter personer som säger VI och inte JAG.


Sist men inte minst, vi vill att du skall fortsätta att utvecklas och ha kul på jobbet!

**Om Nexer**


Nexer är ett snabbväxande techbolag med rötterna i svensk innovation och entreprenörskap. MyTeam finns på våra kontor i Göteborg, Alingsås och Lidköping, och arbetar med kunder inom olika branscher. På Nexer satsar vi på framtiden, och vi vill att du ska vara en del av den resan.

**Ansökan**: Du ansöker genom att fylla i ansökningsformuläret nedan. Tyvärr kan vi inte ta emot ansökningar via e-post. Har du några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta vår rekryterare, Amanda Stenberg, på amanda.stenberg@nexergroup.com.

title: DevSecOps Tech Lead
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging the status quo in the property management industry. We're committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our cloud-based platform is unique, and we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player in a brief time. Our global product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?  

  



**About the role**  

  



We are looking for a **DevSecOps Tech Lead** to join an expanding Productivity team. The team works with DevOps, SRE and QA across different markets. As a DevSecOps Tech Lead, you will play a crucial role in our software engineering process, ensuring that we work on the right things within the DevSecOps domain. You will work closely with DevSecOps Engineers and architects, but also with the larger software engineering organisation.  

  



Your expertise within DevSecOps and software engineering will be crucial as Odevo increases its global footprint.

 **Your key responsibilities will include:**  



* Lead and drive work around strategies, processes, tools, and ways of working.
* Facilitate daily standups, sprint planning, retrospectives, and other agile ceremonies for the DevOps/Productivity team.
* Ensure the team adheres to agile principles, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and efficiency.
* Own and manage the team’s backlog, ensuring that tasks are clearly defined, properly prioritized, and aligned with the overall goals of the organization.
* Develop and maintain the long-term roadmap for the DevOps/Productivity team, ensuring alignment with the overall product and company strategy.
* Balance short-term needs with long-term vision, continuously refining the roadmap based on changing priorities and new insights.
* Engage with engineering teams across the organization to understand their requirements and areas where DevOps and productivity improvements can provide maximum value.
* Communicate progress, challenges, and risks to relevant stakeholders, ensuring transparency around the team’s work.
* Identify and drive continuous improvement opportunities within the DevOps and productivity domain to enhance team efficiency, reduce bottlenecks, and streamline workflows.
* Stay current with industry best practices and emerging technologies that could improve the organization’s DevOps capabilities.
* Proactively identify potential risks and roadblocks, working with the team to find solutions that minimize disruption and keep projects on track.
* Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the impact of DevOps/productivity initiatives on engineering effectiveness.
* Use data to inform decision-making and guide prioritization.

**Who you are**


You have hands-on experience and a solid background in DevOps and a deep understanding of the software development lifecycle. You have experience working closely with engineering teams, understanding their needs, and driving initiatives that improve productivity and efficiency. With strong experience in agile methodologies, you thrive in environments where you can lead ceremonies, prioritize backlogs, and maintain long-term roadmaps. You’re adept at collaborating with cross-functional teams and can effectively translate technical challenges into actionable priorities, ensuring the best value is delivered for engineering organizations.  

  



**Experience**

  

* 5+ years of experience working in DevOps, Engineering Productivity, or a related technical role within a software development organization.
* Hands-on experience with DevOps practices, tools, and infrastructure, with a strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines, automation, and cloud-based environments.
* Ability to lead agile ceremonies (standups, sprint planning, retrospectives) and drive agile best practices within cross-functional teams.
* Experience in managing backlogs, prioritizing work, and developing long-term roadmaps that align with business goals.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with engineering teams to identify pain points and prioritize impactful improvements.
* A solid understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and how DevOps principles can enhance productivity and quality throughout the process.
* Experience with tracking and measuring KPIs to drive continuous improvement and operational excellence.
* Strong understanding of security best practices in the DevOps domain, with experience integrating security (DevSecOps) to ensure safe and compliant software delivery.

**What we offer**  

  



* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.
* Office with stunning views over Stockholm!

**Location**

While we have an office in Stockholm, it is a fully remote position if that suits you best. Our office is on the top floor in the newly built Sthlm 04, which offers stunning views over Stockholm.  

  



**Excited?**

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.  

  



Why we formed Odevo  

About Odevo
  

Our Software

* erfarenhet av lösningar med e-tjänster

**Meriterande:**


erfarenhet av Blazor  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 17-10-2024

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 **Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.  

  

Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.


Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.  

  

Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket garanterar vi ej återkoppling.

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **3+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.  

  

For our client we are looking for a **Senior Platform Engineer**.

  

At clients, they are making bold digital visions come true. They aim to lead in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making the customers' lives less complicated. Now Client is looking for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking.

 **What’s in it for you?**


Client is on an ambitious journey to redefine the customer experience in automotive through digital technology. Electrification, Autonomous Drive and Shared Mobility are enablers for the purpose – freedom to move in a personal, sustainable, and safe way.


Software engineering is an increasingly important area in the automotive industry. Client is bringing more of the software development in-house to better handle continuous integration and the complex interactions between different functions. The data vision at Clients is powering innovation and every decision with trusted data and manage obstacles through innovative, robust designs and design for change.

  

This is a unit within Software Engineering, with a clear purpose to make the consumers feel special and rewarded by delivering leading Scandinavian design and seamless connectivity. They work in a fun and high-paced organization, and you can now join the department. Their mission is to provide trusted data and insights to understand product & process performance and customer behavior, enabling improved efficiency and better customer experience.

  

Client is growing and they are therefore now looking for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking. They are looking for a Platform Engineer within Data and Analytics.

  

This team, working to accelerate and streamline the use of data, analytics, and AI. The team innovates and collaborates to offer a great user experience, and to provide a unified self-service platform.  



  

**What will you do?**


As a Platform Engineer, you will be at the forefront of designing and building a Platform to bolster the data and analytics capabilities of the clients Engineering organization. Your responsibilities will include configuring and setting up cloud infrastructure, deploying and operating data-oriented applications on Kubernetes, and working closely with other teams and platform users to gather requirements and maintain seamless operations. They are in an early development phase, which means you will have the unique opportunity of contributing directly to the Platform's foundation. Your input will directly shape its trajectory, setting the stage for its future growth and success.

 **Some of the tech they use today:**

* Languages: Python, Go
* Cloud infrastructure: Azure, Kubernetes
* DevOps: Terraform, Crossplane, GitHub Actions, Flux, Helm, Prometheus, Grafana, Vault
* PaaS: Databricks, Snowflake

 **Who are you?**


They are looking for a proactive individual with a solution-oriented mindset, who is proficient in the following areas:

* Public cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS, or equivalent).
* Implementation of scalable infrastructure through an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) approach.
* CI/CD with tools such as GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, etc.
* Deployment and operation of applications and services on Kubernetes.
* Design and implementation of internal developer platforms.

 **In addition, experience in any of the following is highly valued:**

* Networking, security, and reliability in enterprise cloud solutions.
* Tools and technologies for working with Big Data, including event streaming (e.g. Kafka, MQTT), large-scale data processing (e.g. Apache Spark, Ray), and storage solutions for Big Data (e.g. Apache Iceberg, Delta Lake).
* User and device authentication, data and resource access control, and data privacy protection.

  

Client believes you have minimum of 7 of experience in related fields , that you are familiar with Agile methods, and that you are fluent in English, both verbal and written. You are a person with a proactive approach, a problem solver, and a flexible team player. This role is based in Gothenburg, Sweden, and client is an office-first culture so you will be expected to work the majority of time from the office in Torslanda, Gothenburg.

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Data Scientist, Sweden - BCG X
description:
Who We Are


Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.  

  

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

 **We Are BCG X**

  

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

  

What You'll Do


Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We are looking for dedicated individuals with a passion for data science, statistics, operations research and redefining organizations into AI led innovative companies. Successful candidates possess the following:* Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
* Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
* Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
* Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
* Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
* Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
* Have strong project management skills

  

What You'll Bring

**TECHNOLOGIES:**

  

Programming Languages: Python

  

#LI-DNI

  

#BCGXjob

  

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
  

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
**Position: Senior DevOps Engineer** 




**Location: Sweden** 




**Job Type: [Full-time/Part-time/Contract]** 




  





**About Us:** 




 DataBees is seeking a skilled Senior DevOps Engineer to join our team for an exciting client project. We are committed to delivering solutions and optimizing our development processes. If you are passionate about automation and enhancing team collaboration, we want to hear from you!
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




  





 Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines to automate deployment processes.
 



 Collaborate with development teams to streamline workflows and enhance software delivery.
 



 Utilize GitHub Enterprise for version control and collaboration on code repositories in enterprise projects.
 



 Develop and maintain containerized applications using Docker.
 



 Write scripts and tools in Bash and Python to automate routine tasks and improve efficiency.
 



 Implement and manage infrastructure as code using Terraform to streamline deployment processes and enhance system reliability.
 



 Manage and configure Ab Initio tools and components to support data integration, transformation, and analytics workflows.
 



 Monitor and troubleshoot system performance and issues within production environments.
 



 Assist in data migration processes, ensuring data integrity and security.
 



 Work closely with data lake platform teams to align DevOps practices with project requirements.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 




  





 Strong understanding of CI/CD methodologies and automation tools.
 



 Proven experience with Azure DevOps,Terraform,GitHub Enterprise, Docker, Bash, and Python.
 



 Familiarity with Azure DevOps and Ab Initio Admin is a plus.
 



 Experience in data migration projects is desirable.
 



 Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
 



 Strong communication skills and attention to detail.
 



  





**Preferred Skills:** 




  





 Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their DevOps services.
 



 Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana).
 



 Understanding of infrastructure as code (IaC) principles and tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible).
 



  





**How to Apply:** 




 If you are a motivated DevOps professional looking to make an impact, please submit your resume and a cover letter to surat.priya@databees.ai with the subject line "Senior DevOps Engineer Application."
 



  





**Application Deadline: 12.10.2024**

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**Vill du vara med och forma framtidens molnlösningar?**
 På grund av stark tillväxt och ökande efterfrågan från våra kunder söker vi nu en skicklig Cloud Engineer till vårt team. Hos Capgemini får du chansen att arbeta med spännande och betydelsefulla projekt för ledande organisationer i en dynamisk och internationell miljö. Bli en del av vår framgång och bidra till att driva innovativa lösningar framåt!
   

  

**Vem du kommer att arbeta med**
 Du blir en del av Capgeminis Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS)-enhet med fokus på projekt- och konsulttjänster i Norden. Vårt mål är att erbjuda kunder helhetslösningar inom Cloud med branschspecifik expertis, avancerad molnteknik och globala resurser. Vi erbjuder en mängd olika tjänster, från strategisk rådgivning till projektgenomförande.
   

  

**Fokus i din roll**
 Syftet med rollen är att hjälpa kunder att ta till sig och nyttja den fulla potentialen i Public Cloud och du kommer att leda och arbeta i tvärfunktionella projekt. Du kommer att ingå i en community av likasinnade, skickliga cloud engineers och vara delaktig i att driva standardisering, policys och best practise för åtaganden inom Norden. I mindre team tillsammans med andra engineers från olika expertområden kommer du att bygga stödjande, hållbara och pålitliga plattformstjänster. Du kommer att använda både open source-tekniker och leverantörsbaserade lösningar.
   

  

**Cloud Engineer hos Capgemini**
 Cloud Engineer är en framväxande roll inom Capgemini och efterfrågan av erfarenhet och kunskap inom området är hög. Våra kunder har som ambition att leverera IT-tjänster snabbare och mer effektivt, som svar på det ständigt föränderliga konkurrenslandskapet och våra cloud engineers kommer att hjälpa dem att uppnå det.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att ha ett nära samarbete med arkitekter, kunder, partners och andra affärsenheter för att designa och implementera innovativa och konkurrenskraftiga molnlösningar för våra kunder.
   

  

**Din bakgrund och erfarenhet**
 För att vara framgångsrik i rollen har du stor erfarenhet av att designa och implementera tekniska lösningar och verktyg i AWS, Azure eller GCP. Du bör vara van vid projekt- och konsultarbete och kunna engagera dig var som helst i projektets livscykel, från inledande kunddiskussioner enda fram till automatiserad leverans och hantering av plattformsmiljöer som utnyttjar DevOps.
   

  

**Vidare Ser Vi Gärna**
* Praktisk erfarenhet av AWS-, Azure- och/eller GCP, helst med leverantörscertifieringar
* Erfarenhet av migrering, implementering av landningszoner och/eller Financial Operations (FinOps)
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Kubernetes och Docker Containers
* Praktisk erfarenhet av automation och orkestrering med verktyg som Packer, Terraform, Cloud Formation
* God kunskap inom cloud networking och lastbalansering
* Exponering och förståelse för automatiserad build pipeline, continous integration och continous deployment – samt erfarenhet av att implementera verktyg som stödjer dessa metoder
* Scripting-kunskaper i minst en av följande: Go, Ruby, Python
* Erfarenhet av Linux
* Kunskap om DevOps-koncept, aspekter och verktyg
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leverera i agila miljöer
* God kommunikationsförmåga i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt


 Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of nearly 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2022 global revenues of €22 billion. Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
To succeed in our journey towards a world without fossil fuels, we are building technical solutions that will help stabilize the energy grid as well help optimize the energy usage of our customers. Now we are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer, who can help us integrate and deploy more efficiently in our AWS platform!
   

  

**The role**
 As our Senior DevOps Engineer, your focus will be to drive learning and develop platform services for developers to adapt. You will set up and administrate our AWS-platform, working with CI/CD, Testing and Automation. In fact, the structure for our cloud infrastructure will be your responsibility!
   

  

 We are a quite small engineering organization today consisting of three teams. Your direct leader will be our Head of Engineering Danny Hajj, feel free to check out his LinkedIn profile here!
   

  

**Are we at match?**
 To thrive at Svea Solar we think it's important that our values correlates with your own since they are the guiding stars that help us move forward. For you to succeed in the role as our Senior DevOps Engineer, we believe you should have multiple years’ experience working with cloud-native CI/CD workflows and tools. Of course, you also should have great knowledge of full software development life cycle and delivery using agile practices.
   

  

 We believe you have:
   

  

 Hands-on experience with microservices and distributed application architecture, such as containers, Kubernetes, and/or serverless technology.
   

  

 If you also have at least 2 of the following, we are sure we would be a good match;
   

  

* Experience in code development in at least one object-oriented programming language.
* Experience with automating cloud-native technologies, deploying applications, and provisioning infrastructure.
* Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code, using AWS CDK, Cloudformation, or other tools
* Experience with self-hosted Grafana observability stack.


 At Svea Solar we believe in Collaboration-first mentality which is why we work three days at the office to share ideas and better collaborate between the teams.

title: DevSecOps Engineer (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our team:**
 Agoda’s DevOps department is a vibrant and synergistic collective, comprised of highly proficient engineers with expertise across various domains. We’re dedicated to improving the developer productivity by providing best-in-class developer experience through seamless integration of development and operations. Our team works on comprehensive full-stack solutions, overseeing projects from conceptual design to the deployment of functional applications. This includes crafting intuitive user interfaces, robust APIs, core system functionalities, and implementing scalable data storage solutions across a distributed network. We work with the security team to provide a platform and company-wide integrations. Our work affects all the IT department at Agoda, turning even minor issues into exciting challenges due to the scale and speed we operate at.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 DevSecOps Engineer is a pivotal role within our DevOps organization. You will be responsible for development and implementation with the focus of providing security as a platform. You will be a key contributor to the team and it would require broad knowledge of the technology stack across the industry. You will have the opportunity to be impactful across the entire SDLC process. For you to succeed in this role, you should strive to balance the industry best-practice with Agoda’s scale. A developer-centric approach is essential, as you will be expected to empathize with and address the needs of our development teams, fostering a culture where security is ingrained in every aspect of our workflow.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Maintain CI/CD best practices and automate security testing at the speed of DevOps on a very large scale (:1M pipelines a month)
* Design, implement, and monitor in-house built security tooling chain
* Maintain a platform that includes a complex automated security scoring system for every development component at Agoda


**What you’ll need to succeed:**
* Excellent coding skills in a modern programming language (preferably Go, Rust, or Python)
* Software architecture design skills for achieving high availability and fault tolerance
* Knowledge of network security and application security concepts
* Familiarity with development ecosystem tooling: Git, CI, Docker, Kubernetes
* Experience with Linux system administration
* Passion for learning cutting-edge technologies and automating large scale processes
* Excellent collaboration and communication skill


**It’s great if you have:**
* Familiarity with secure coding best practices
* Experience utilizing modern CI systems (e.g., GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, CircleCI, Jenkins)
* Advanced Kubernetes & Docker knowledge (plus points for experience with k8s operator development)
* Experience working with a service mesh
* Configuration management experience (e.g., Ansible, Terraform)
* Extended knowledge in securing an application security in CI/CD (e.g., SAST, DAST)
* Experience coding a full-stack application (preferably with React.js and Go)
* Experience with HashiCorp tools (Consul, Vault, Terraform)
* Experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, MSSQL)


 #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #prague #Brno #Ostrava #cairo #alexandria #giza #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #kualalumpur #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #bucharest #moscow #saintpetersburg #capetown #johannesburg #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #kiev #hcmc #hanoi #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #IT #ENG #4 #IT #4 #5
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Container Platform Engineer - Kubernetes/AKS Specialist
company_industry: Banking, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
Now, we're on the lookout for a skilled Kubernetes/Container expert to join us as we have the pedal to the metal on expansion of our container platform offerings, whether it's on-premise with OpenShift or in the cloud, primarily on Azure AKS.
   

  

 Swedbank is at the forefront of an exhilarating transformation, as the banking industry rapidly adapts to fast-paced innovation and evolving customer expectations. The Container Platform operates within the "Development Platforms" unit, where fostering excellent Developer Experience (DevEx) is paramount. Our solutions are utilized across the entire bank. We are driving the cultural shift necessary for modern software development practices and delivering exceptional services to our customers.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Drive innovation and contribute to impactful projects that make a difference in society, leveraging your expertise in Kubernetes and containerization.
* Be in a supportive and collaborative work environment where your ideas are valued, and your contributions makes a difference.
* Work on impactful projects that have a meaningful impact and shapes the future of banking.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).
+ Preferred: Relevant certifications within the AKS domain (AZ-104, 500, 120, 700, 305, 204 etc..)

* Strong customer-facing skills, with the ability to communicate effectively and build lasting relationships.
* Proven track record in AKS operations, troubleshooting, and performance optimization.
* Experience with platform automation, including CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, and configuration management.
* Understanding of multi-tenancy, security, and governance in cloud-native environments.
* Agile mindset, adaptable to changing requirements and priorities.
* Passion for innovation, staying aligned with container advancements and industry trends.


 What we offer when you join us:
   

  

* An open, simple and caring culture
* Opportunity to create the best experience for our customers
* An international, sustainable and inclusive work environment
* Development opportunities and advancement in your career
* Flexible working options
* Access to Group performance program, company pension plan, optional health insurance, and other benefits


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 Shape the future of banking!
 **Johan Edeljung,** 
**your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 27.10.2024.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sundbyberg
   

  

**Recruiting manager:** 
 Johan Edeljung, +46 724517865
   

  

 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Senior Atlassian Konsult
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.
   

  

**Vår ambitioner**
 Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* minst 5 års praktisk erfarenhet av teknisk analys av lösning och genomförande
* minst 3 års praktisk erfarenhet av att transformera arbetsflöden till DevOps
* genomfört 2 migreringar inom Atlassians produktsvit
* minst 5 års erfarenhet av konfiguration av Atlassianprodukterna Jira, Confluence och Bitbucket
* minst 2 års erfarenhet av integrationer inom Atlassianprodukterna Jira, Confluence & Bitbucket
* minst 2 års erfarenhet av integrationer mellan Atlassianprodukter (Jira Cloud, Confluence cloud) och andra applikationer
* kunskap om bästa praxis och riktlinjer inom Atlassian konfiguration kopplat till organisationer som arbetar med SAFe och agila arbetssätt
* minst 2 års erfarenhet av Jira Plans (som tidigare hette “Advanced Roadmaps” i Jira)
* erfarenhet av att i Jira konfigurera för kravnivåer och portföljhantering kopplat till SAFe
* minst 1 års erfarenhet av att utbilda kring agilt arbetssätt i Jira och Confluence
* kunskap och erfarenhet av att kommunicera tekniska koncept och idéer både skriflitgt och muntligt
* erfarenhet av att ha implementerat SAFe-arbetssätt i Atlassian Jira
* erfarenhet av att analysera och lösa komplexa utmaningar


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 18-10-2024
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.
   

  

 Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.
   

  

 Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket garanterar vi ej återkoppling.

title: Infrastructure Architect and Tech lead, Engineering (Full-time)
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we are shaping the digital future by securing trusted identities for millions around the globe. Our cutting-edge Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms redefine how we trust and interact in a world driven by digital transformation. Do you want to be at the forefront of this technological revolution?*
**We’re looking for an Infrastructure Tech Lead and Architect**
 Henrik Hjelm, Director of Infrastructure, is seeking an experienced, hands-on technical lead to drive the strategic direction of our Infrastructure team in Stockholm. If you have a strong foundation in both public and private cloud environments, a passion for automation, and the expertise to architect secure, scalable infrastructures, this is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Lead or team in their day-to-day operations and act as a senior architect to advanced, secure, and scalable infrastructure solutions for global products and clients, impacting millions of users.
* Join an innovative company driving the "Zero Trust" identity revolution for people and things, in both physical and digital worlds.
* Be the technical authority for infrastructure strategy, helping the team towards high levels of automation, efficiency, and security.
* Collaborate closely with product teams and clients to deliver critical infrastructure solutions and services.
* Continuous professional development in the security, identity, and cloud automation space.


**What You’ll Do as Infrastructure Tech Lead and Architect**
* Architect, design, and guide the development of secure, scalable, and highly available infrastructure solutions across public, private, and hybrid cloud environments.
* Ensure alignment between infrastructure architecture, strategic business goals, and client expectations.
* Help define and drive the technical roadmap for infrastructure automation and optimization using technologies such as Terraform, Ansible, OpenStack, AWS, Azure, and containerization.
* Lead incident, problem, and change management processes, ensuring the team’s timely and efficient response to operational needs.
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure seamless communication and process optimization across teams.


**Your Expertise**
* A proven track record as an Infrastructure Architect, Infrastructure Engineer, or similar role, with significant experience managing complex, scalable, and secure environments.
* Expertise in Infrastructure as Code, using tools such as Terraform and Ansible for automation, and extensive knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure) and Linux.
* A deep understanding of best practices in security, scalability, and cloud-native architectures.
* Proficient in modern infrastructure tools like Datadog, Azure DevOps Pipelines, and container orchestration platforms.
* You work independently, driving processes with minimal supervision, while also collaborating and lead the team to achieve collective success.


**Qualifications**
* You are senior team member, with a very strong technical acumen and broad knowledge within Infrastructure. You don't need to have previous leader experience, but curious about taking steps towards more leadership roles
* Many years of experience in infrastructure architecture with a deep technical background in Linux, cloud environments, and automation technologies.
* A passion for automating infrastructure processes and a desire to work with complex, scalable solutions.
* Experienced in leading technical project/technical project management
* Due to customer requirements you need to be unhindered in Swedish (written and spoken) as well a proficient in English.


**What’s Next?**
* Apply now by uploading your CV in English.
* The final candidate will undergo a background check to ensure our commitment to transparency, security, and trust.


 At Nexus, we believe in diversity and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to building a workplace where personal experiences and unique perspectives thrive. Join us to innovate and help secure the future in a dynamic and evolving digital world.

title: Senior DevOps
description:
*Är du en erfaren DevOps-ingenjör med gedigen kunskap i AWS och Linux-miljöer? Ta chansen att fortsätta utvecklas i en innovativ miljö tillsammans med mycket kunniga kollegor!* 




  





**Om företaget** 




 Adtraction är en ledande aktör inom digital marknadsföring i Norden och erbjuder en avancerad plattform som kopplar samman annonsörer med partners för att främja försäljning. Plattformen fungerar som en marknadsplats där annonsörer, som strävar efter att öka sin försäljning, kan samarbeta med olika typer av partners såsom influencers, bloggare, forum, mobilappar och prisjämförelsesajter. Dessa partners kan genom sitt innehåll skapa intäkter genom provision som betalas ut via Adtraction när marknadsföringen resulterar i försäljning.
 



  





 Adtraction har lokala kontor i tolv länder i Europa, med sitt huvudkontor i Stockholm där du kommer att arbeta i moderna lokaler tillsammans med 30 kollegor. I rollen får du möjlighet att arbeta med mycket duktiga kollegor där du, trots din gedigna erfarenhet, kommer få utvecklas och utmanas!
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 I rollen som Senior DevOps-ingenjör har du ett övergripande ansvar för att bygga, optimera och underhålla infrastruktur och arbetsflöden för systemutveckling och drift. Du arbetar nära både utvecklingsteam och driftteam för att säkerställa en stabil och skalbar produktionsmiljö. En central del av ditt arbete är att automatisera och förbättra CI/CD-processer samt hantera infrastruktur som kod.
 



  





 Du ansvarar för containerorkestrering med Kubernetes (gärna EKS) och säkerställer att applikationer kan skalas effektivt i en molnbaserad miljö (AWS). Vidare arbetar du aktivt med att förbättra övervakning, logging och prestandaoptimering med verktyg som Grafana och Prometheus.
 



  





 Utöver detta har du ett stort fokus på säkerhet och prestanda och är med och sätter strategier för hur infrastrukturen och systemarkitekturen kontinuerligt kan förbättras.
 



  





 • Ansvara för att automatisera och optimera CI/CD-pipelines med hjälp av verktyg som GitLab
 



 • Arbeta med containerorkestrering i Kubernetes för att säkerställa skalbara och robusta miljöer
 



 • Hantera och utveckla infrastruktur som kod med verktyg som Terraform och CloudFormation
 



 • Skapa och underhålla molnbaserade lösningar i AWS, med fokus på säkerhet och prestandaoptimering
 



 • Övervaka system och applikationer med verktyg som Grafana, Prometheus och Elastic SIEM
 



 • Samarbeta med utvecklings- och driftteam för att säkerställa en smidig övergång från utveckling till drift
 



 • Leda arbetet med att identifiera och lösa driftproblem samt genomföra förbättringar av systemens stabilitet och tillgänglighet
 



  





**Utbildning, erfarenhet och personliga egenskaper** 




 • Flera års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete inom DevOps eller SysOps, med fokus på automation och molnbaserade lösningar
 



 • Gedigen erfarenhet av Linux-miljöer
 



 • Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med AWS-tjänster som EC2, CloudFront, Lambda, RDS och EKS
 



 • Erfarenhet av infrastruktur som kod (Terraform, CloudFormation eller motsvarande verktyg)
 



 • Erfarenhet av att arbeta med containerorkestrering, gärna med Kubernetes
 



 • God programmeringsvana, gärna i Java och Python
 



 • Erfarenhet av att bygga och optimera CI/CD-pipelines, gärna med GitLab
 



 • Obehindrad svenska och engelska i tal samt skrift
 



 • Meriterande med erfarenhet av övervaknings- och loggverktyg som Grafana, Prometheus och Elastic SIEM samt kunskap om byggsystem som Maven och npm
 



  





 För att lyckas i rollen är du en strukturerad och lösningsorienterad person, med ett starkt fokus på automatisering och effektivisering. Du har ett stort tekniskt intresse och en förmåga att arbeta både operativt och strategiskt. Du är en samarbetsinriktad person som trivs med att arbeta nära utvecklings- och driftteam, samtidigt som du har förmågan att arbeta självständigt och driva egna initiativ. Vidare har du ett analytiskt sinne och en förmåga att identifiera förbättringsområden och implementera lösningar som ökar systemens stabilitet och skalbarhet.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



**Plats:** 
 Linnégatan 89A, Stockholm.
 



  





 Den här tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Brillante och du anställs direkt hos Adtraction. Vi gör ett löpande urval, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
 



  





 Vid frågor eller funderingar, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Elice Öhman via
 **elice.ohman@bravura.se** 
 eller 076-721 49 82.

title: Azure Cloud Engineer
description:
**About Bluestep Bank** 




 At Bluestep Bank, we are passionate about enabling more people to get a mortgage. Our vision is to increase financial inclusion in society in a responsible way; by embracing our customers’ differences and focusing on their future potential.
 



  





 A
 **bout the role** 




 As an Azure Cloud Engineer, you will be a key contributor to the architecture and optimization of our Microsoft Azure-based cloud infrastructure. Your primary responsibility is to ensure our cloud systems are highly performant, secure, and reliable, allowing us to consistently deliver top-tier services to our customers. This is an exciting time to join us! You’ll have the opportunity to make a significant impact by shaping the architecture, design, and implementation of cutting-edge cloud solutions as we continue our rapid growth and digital evolution.
 



  





**What you will do** 




 As part of a team of 4 Cloud Engineers within IT Operations, your primary focus will be to maintain and enhance the performance, security, and scalability of our public cloud platforms. Collaborate closely with product development teams to streamline CI/CD pipelines and Kubernetes management.
 



  





 Your role will be crucial in designing, building, and maintaining a scalable, automated cloud infrastructure that aligns with our digital transformation goals. As a smaller bank, we have the agility to innovate quickly, and we recognize that investing in modern technology is vital to our continued success.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 We’re looking for someone with a minimum of 3 years of experience working with Azure public cloud, whether you come from an IT Operations, Development, or DevOps background. If you have a broad understanding of networking, storage, and identity management, cost optimization, and overall Azure governance and architecture you're the right fit for this role.
 



 To succeed in this role, we believe you are an excellent communicator with experience working in a team. You have a diplomatic approach when collaborating with stakeholders, and you are fluent in English, both written and spoken.
 



  





 Psst, we're extra interested if you also have experience with:
 



 • Containerization in Kubernetes
 



 • Hybrid environments and cloud migrations
 



 • Microsoft SQL
 



 • Powershell
 



 • IaaC such as Bicep or Terraform
 



  





**We offer** 




 Along with a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive insurance and benefits package that includes health insurance, occupational pension, extra vacation days, parental leave pay, wellness benefits, lunch benefit, possibility for a bike benefit, and the flexibility of a hybrid workplace model, among others.
 



  





 As part of our company, you will be part of an open-minded and inclusive culture, characterized by engagement and innovation where we dare to challenge and change. We believe in the values of co-operation and different perspectives. For the right person, we provide great opportunities for an exciting career.
 



  





 Join our team and enjoy not only a rewarding career but also the perks of being part of a supportive and inclusive workplace.
 **Welcome as you are** 
 .
 



  





 Are you ready to take the first step toward joining us?
 



  





**Application** 




 We would be happy to see your application as soon as possible as the selection is ongoing.
 



 In this recruitment, Bluestep Bank collaborates with HCM partners. For questions and concerns, please contact Stina Lönnroth at Stina@hcmpartner.se or 073 862 96 49 or Sara Burman at sara@hcmpartner.se 070 824 91 50.
 



  





*Embracing inclusivity, we value each candidate based on their skills and experience. There is no need to include a photo in your application.*
