title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Assignment description :** 




  





 On behalf of our client, we are seeking a Senior Data Engineer to contribute to the development of a new analytics platform on Azure. The ideal candidate should be self-motivated and driven, with a strong commitment to teamwork and collaboration. A key aspect of this role involves sharing knowledge and supporting fellow team members on a daily basis.
 



  





**Role Description:** 




 You will be responsible for developing use cases on the new analytics platform to replace the existing analytics functionalities. This includes building new features based on business needs and further enhancing production-level capabilities on the new platform in collaboration with the team.
 



  





 Additionally, you will contribute to shaping working methods and processes, ensuring effective collaboration within the team, across teams, and with the business. You will also play a key role in fostering skill development within the group.
 



  





**Qualifications and Responsibilities:** 




  





**Experience:** 
 Minimum of 8 years in data engineering services, data management, programming, and advanced analytics, with expertise in building data platforms on both on-premises and cloud environments.
 



  





**Technical Skills:** 




  





  - Proficient in Python and SQL ,AbInitio.
 



  - Familiarity with various data management technologies, including NoSQL and distributed systems; knowledge of Scala is a plus.
 



  





 Cloud Architecture:
 



  - Experience in designing and architecting cloud-based data solutions using platforms such as Azure.
 



  - Solid understanding of software architecture principles, with a focus on writing resilient, scalable, and maintainable code.
 



  





 Microsoft Azure Expertise:
 



  - Design and develop data pipelines using Azure Data Factory.
 



  - Code advanced data processing solutions in Azure Databricks.
 



  - Conceptualize and implement solutions using Azure Synapse, Azure SQL, and Azure Data Lake.
 



  - Utilize Azure DevOps for development and code management.
 



  





**Collaboration:** 




  





  - Work closely with Business Analysts and Data Analysts to understand product requirements and suggest optimal data models for both back-end and front-end performance.
 



  - Collaborate with platform teams, core system data engineers, and data scientists to support advanced analytics use cases.
 



  





**Employment : Contract or Full Time** 




**Location : Sweden** 




**Availability : 100%** 




**Mode of work : Hybrid ( 2-3 days a week on-site)** 




  





**If you are interested and have relevant skills please apply through this job post or contact us through the following email ID : surat.priya@databees.ai**

title: System engineer Red Hat Linux
description:
Vill du jobba med teknik i framkant samtidigt som bidra till samhällsnytta? Vill du vara med och forma Skatteverkets och våra kundmyndigheters framtida it-miljö? På Skatteverkets it-avdelning bygger vi inte bara bra system utan även grunden för ett väl fungerande samhälle. Hos oss får du arbetsuppgifter som gör skillnad, kombinerat med utvecklingsmöjligheter och balans mellan arbete och fritid. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Skatteverkets it-avdelning är en av Sveriges största, med en stor och komplex it-miljö. Vi ansvarar för drift, förvaltning och utveckling av Skatteverkets- och våra kunders it-system. Nu går vi in i en ny fas av uppbyggnad och innovation då vi kommer att stärka vår leverans av it-tjänster och it-drift till fler statliga myndigheter. Därför utökar vi nu vårt team som ansvar för Red Hat Linux och OpenShift plattformen. Tillsammans med kunniga och nytänkande kollegor kommer du bidra till Skatteverkets uppdrag att skapa samhällsnytta.
   

  

 I rollen som system engineer ingår du i ett mindre team som arbetar DevOps inriktat. Du kommer tillsammans med övriga i teamet arbeta med underhåll och utveckling av Skatteverkets Linuxplattform och Red Hat OpenShift containerplattform. I teamet arbetar ni även tillsammans med andra intressenter där ni identifiera förbättringar, designar och utvecklar lösningar för att förbättra likväl som att effektivisera plattformarna. Arbetet sker både i team och individuellt.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens- och teknikutveckling. Du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* flerårig, relevant och aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling av RedHat Linux plattform
* relevant erfarenhet av att automatisera med exempelvis Bash eller Ansible


 Det är önskvärt om du har arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling med Red Hat Satellite 6. Det är meriterande om du har arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling inom Red Hat OpenShift samt erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av SSSD, RedHat IDM samt freeIPA. Erfarenhet av rsyslog är även det meriterande.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/367 | Kontakt: Caroline Törnkvist (HR-specialist rekrytering) caroline.tornkvist@skatteverket.se, Daniel Bynander (Rekryterande chef) daniel.bynander@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-09-17 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-16

title: Senior Solutions Architect, AWS Industries
description:
**Description**
 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a technical leader to help global telecommunications Independent Software Vendors (ISVs), Network Equipment Providers (NEPs), and Communications service providers (CSP) transform their businesses with AWS technology.
   

  

 Senior Solutions Architects are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Senior Solutions Architects also take a leading role in creating and presenting technical content and best practices.
   

  

 The problem domains are diverse: 5G monetization, network function virtualization, digital customer journeys, OSS/BSS transformation, mobile edge computing, hyperscale data, cybersecurity, SaaS evolution and Enterprise IT. At your disposal is the breadth of AWS, including artificial intelligence, edge computing, IoT, and data analytics.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As part of the Telecommunications Solutions Architecture team, you will collaborate with customers, internal AWS teams, and AWS partners to deliver solutions to the unique challenges of information and operational technology in telecom customers.
   

  

 You will be the single-threaded owner of the AWS technology strategy for your customer and account team to drive AWS adoption. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value while assessing risks, balancing trade-offs, and encouraging risk-tasking to maximize your customer's business value of AWS is critical to a solutions architect. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think long-term about business, product, and technical outcomes.
   

  

 Role requires domestic and international (mainly Europe) travel up to 30%.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our team is small and motivated. We come from diverse backgrounds, but what we all have in common is a huge curiosity, a passion for delighting our customers, and a desire to deliver technology that transforms their business. What’s it like to work at AWS? Our team experiences high levels of collaboration, lots of multi-tasking, and often course corrections or new ideas that mean adaptability is key. We find creative and scalable solutions to our customers’ difficult problems, and we own delivering those outcomes to the customer. We are also a geographically-distributed team, which means you will need to possess a high bias for taking action without immediate team consensus.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering, DevOps, SaaS
* Experience driving technical and/or organizational change of significant complexity
* Experience in a customer-facing technology or engineering role
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, - Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
* Language fluency: English
* A passion for technology and for learning


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience working in a customer-facing role or a role which involved public speaking.
* Experience in Pre-Sales Solution Engineering
* AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate, AWS Solutions Architect Professional)
* Other industry certification (e.g. TMForum, Togaf)
* Experience in or with telecommunications service providers, network equipment manufacturers, or related telecom ecosystem partners
* Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT systems - either on premises or in the cloud
* Working knowledge of cloud native architectures
* In-depth working knowledge in a technology domain such as distributed internet-scale web or mobile applications, DevOps, Serverless, Big Data, Analytics, Machine Learning, enterprise workloads, high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads, Enterprise IT.
* Language fluency: one or more between Swedish, Finnish, Norwegian


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2797836

title: Senior System Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 At King, the Engineering System & Support (ESS) team provides critical capabilities for our developers, including continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD), build infrastructure, and dependent services. Our team manages repository solutions for code, binaries, and libraries, build pipelines, and code quality/review tools. These components are integrated into a cohesive stack that includes configuration management, tool integrations, and infrastructure technologies.
   

  

 We are now seeking an experienced and passionate Senior Systems Engineer to join our team and help us build on this success!
   

  

 We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about the role. Not sure you meet all other qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
   

  

**Your Role Within Our Kingdom**
 As a Sr. Systems Engineer on the ESS team, you will be involved in large-scale system design and troubleshooting, your focus will be to provide a high quality Developer Experience by implementing and improving ESS services and products. Our main goal as a team is to contribute to speed up the Game Development Lifecycle.
   

  

 Skills To Create Thrills
   

  

**Skills To Create Thrills**
 We are seeking a talented DevOps Engineer with expertise in managing Linux (Debian, Ubuntu) operating systems, which is required, while experience with Windows OS and Mac OSX is desired. In the realm of configuration management and Infrastructure as Code (IaaC), you should have required experience with Puppet (r10K, Hiera, Modules, PuppetDB) and Terraform. Packer and Helm experience is also desirable.
   

  

 You must have required experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP, along with Docker and Kubernetes. For development services, proficiency in Git is required, and familiarity with the GitHub ecosystem, Artifactory, Jenkins, SonarQube, Perforce, Incredibuild, and Veertu Anka Build is desirable.
   

  

 Your scripting skills should include Bash as a requirement, with Python, Groovy (for automation), and PowerShell as desired skills. Experience managing web servers or applications using Apache or Nginx is desirable. Familiarity with relational databases and tools for monitoring, alerting, and logging such as Splunk, Prometheus (Alertmanager, Loki, Thanos), and Grafana is also desired. General security awareness is a must.
   

  

 We value soft skills such as effective teamwork across different locations, a supportive attitude for developer teams, the ability to structure and prioritize tasks, problem-solving skills, dedication and a keen interest in learning, knowledge sharing and collaboration, and strong documentation abilities.
   

  

 Tasty bonus skills include experience working with heavy CI/CD pipelines in a multi-OS environment, implementing CI/CD using Kubernetes, and working with Agile methodologies.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Lead, Linux Systems Engineer-R-218087
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
 We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
   

  

**Title And Summary**
 Lead, Linux Systems Engineer
   

  

 Does building CyberSecurity solutions that will enable our customers across the world with faster, smarter and more effective protection from cyber risk excite you? We are looking for a Linux system administrator that will work with our teams in Sweden to improve system reliability, improve operations and build strong partnerships with key stakeholder teams.
   

  

 As part of the platform team, you own, monitor and improve our on-prem infrastructure. This includes physical servers, networking equipment, application and virtualization clusters that power our Threat Protection Platform as well as internal systems.
   

  

 Role
   

  

* Improve system reliability through our ‘you build it, you run it’ philosophy, such as by adding metrics, building dashboards, and documenting.
* Improve our incident management lifecycle to identify, mitigate, and learn from reliability risks.
* Develop strong partnerships with other teams to understand and proactively address future technology needs and current pain points.
* Increase productivity by building internal tools and automation workflows that reduce maintenance overhead and speed up processes.
* Incident response, diagnosis, and follow-up on system outages or alerts across the infrastructure which also includes being part of the on-call rotation.


**About You**
* Previous experience as a Linux system administrator or DevOps engineer.
* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, fluency in coding, and high traffic/ high availability system architecture.
* You actively take ownership of the systems and processes, find and implement improvements throughout their lifecycle.
* Speak English with full professional proficiency or higher.


**Desired Skills & Experience**
* Proficiency in building and managing Kubernetes clusters.
* Expertise in automation tools like Ansible, Puppet, or Saltstack.
* Familiarity with Infrastructure-as-Code (IAC) principles.
* Strong background in Linux and/or BSD operating systems.
* Proficient in at least one programming language, such as Python or Go.
* Knowledge of monitoring technologies, including Prometheus and Grafana.
* Experience in administrating distributed systems like Kafka and Elasticsearch.
* Extensive knowledge of information security, both technical measures and concepts.
* Proficiency in building scalable, reliable and high-performance software applications and systems.
* Solid grasp of the OSI model, networking concepts, and common protocols like ARP, IP, TCP, UDP, and HTTP.
* Understanding of routing protocols like BGP and IS-IS.


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.


 R-218087

title: Senior IT Analyst
description:
**Job ID: 23161**
 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.
   

  





**About this opportunity** 






  
 





 As part of the Application Management team of Savings Distribution domain, you'll be working in a small and dedicated operations and support team. 
 





  

  



 We are seeking a talented and motivated IT Analyst  with a strong background in DevOps to join our dynamic team.  
 





  
 





 As an IT Analyst you will be responsible for managing and maintaining our organization's IT infrastructure while implementing DevOps practices to streamline our development and operations processes. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deploy, automate, and scale our applications and systems effectively. You will help us support our users, developers and our BizDevOps journey, to ensure we are geared towards high quality and low cycle-time and that our customers are our first priority.
 





  

  



 You'll be at the forefront of the transformation in Nordea. We are organized with operations & support, business and development in teams, and have the mandate and ability to imagine, develop, and release digital features to our customers with high speed. 
   

  





**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Act as technical driver,  lead technological initiatives while being actively involved in day-to-day operations.
* Work closely with development teams to integrate DevOps best practices into the software development lifecycle and to enhance collaboration, automation,,efficiency across the organization and and deliver innovative solutions.
* Provide hands-on technical expertise to support project delivery, troubleshooting, and optimization.
* Embrace mindset of continuous improvement,  ensuring both technical excellence and efficient workflows.
* Initiating and driving application dependency and infrastructure upgrade/patching
* Stay updated on industry trends to drive continuous improvements and future-proof solutions.
* Ensure execution and compliance deliverables according to technology delivery plans, observing the priorities, execution structure, funding and capability resource plans
* Ensure continuous alignment with Technology strategy (workforce, partnerships, standards) as well as with common frameworks and awareness of technology trends and opportunities



  
 





 You’ll join a dynamic and fast paced environment where we all lift together, have strong ownership, a passion  for digital business and the ability to make things happen. The role is based in Stockholm.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
 







 You are sharp of mind and always proactive in your actions and planning and you like to ensure our process are fit-for-purpose and strive for simplicity in process re-engineering.
   

  





**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* are result oriented, Hands-on,able to take ownership, reaching out and “making things happen”; be an actor of change.
* are a creative and innovative person with strong problem-solving skills.
* are adaptable, a people person, a tech-savvy professional able to handle volume rather than processes.
* possess curiosity and interest in understanding and fulfilling business requirements to deliver exceptional customer experience and value-creation opportunities through technology
* communicate in a clear and understandable way and know your stakeholders, keep them abreast developments and possible reprioritization in the project.
* understand your own technology domain and delivery options for Change and Run.



  
 





**Your experience** 




**and background:** 





* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in IT operations or system administration roles.
* Strong understanding of ITIL and DevOps principles and practices.
* Proficiency in operating systems such as Windows Server and  Linux
* Monitoring tools as Splunk, Grafana or similar
* Tools as Confluence, Jira
* Knowledge of CI/CD tools
* Proven ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues and implement effective solutions.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work well in a team environment, collaboration with developers and other IT teams to support various initiatives and projects.



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 22/10/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Monika Jovikj.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
  For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
  Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following: 
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. 
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Lead Software Engineering – SRE (Bangkok-based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 Lead Software Engineer in SRE is a part of data team who developing solutions for analytic production incidents, we are working close with our DevOps engineers, NOC, QA, and service owners to improve system reliability with an emphasis on safe deployment and monitoring with anomaly detection technique.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Help establish and apply SRE best practices, standards and policies in hybrid cloud environments with hybrid workloads where both VMs and containers are used
* Develop systems to prevent outages through automatic detection and remediation
* Increase observability of system health to improve availability and system uptime
* Providing guidance and expertise to the team
* Influence, design and create new architectures, standards and methods for large-scale enterprise systems
* Document and present methodologies to operations, engineering and executive teams
* Coach and develop software engineers, looks for opportunities to improve both technical and people through highly effective 1-1s and growth plans


**What You’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems/Engineering/related field
* 4+ years in a technical role supporting IT products
* Ability to multitask and pivot when necessary in a fast-paced environment
* Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
* Deep understanding of computer networks
* Proficient in at least one programming language (e.g. Ruby, JavaScript/NodeJS, Python)
* Understanding of VMs, docker/rkt containers and their applications, K8s, private cloud knowledge is plus
* Hands-on experience designing and implementing monitoring and alerting systems
* Experience in Data platforms like SQL or Hadoop
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
* Incident management process, analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience & can lead the incident
* Can do attitude (sometime we build news thing)
* Data driven & Data analyze skill, we move forward using data

title: Azure Technology Specialists - App Innovation
description:
***This job is with Microsoft, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Overview**
 Are you curious and passionate about tech? Do you enjoy driving change and being part of a collaborative team where we grow together?
   

  

 Come join our fantastic team of deep Azure experts that challenge, support and accelerate our great customers in their cloud adoption, business & AI transformation journey.
   

  

 We cover Core (cloud infrastructure), Data & AI, and App Innovation.
   

  

 We are looking to expand our team with a
 **App Innovation Technical Specialist** 
 that brings a background and passion in software engineering, cloud solution architecture and AI.
   

  

**As An Azure Technical Specialist Team We**
* Work in early stages of an engagement and are the technical experts supporting our sales organization
* Earn trust and win the technical decision
* Drive the solution and architecture design
* Get the customer going with technical workshops and Proof of Concepts
* Accelerate engagements by unblocking technical considerations
* Engages in partner sell-with scenarios by acting as liaison between the partner and team and facilitating partner resources and processes throughout the course of the project
* Captures core competitive knowledge and delivers back to product and engineering teams


**Qualifications**
**Required/minimum qualifications**
* Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND a few years of technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND proven years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR several years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR equivalent experience.


**Additional Or Preferred Qualifications**
* Certification in relevant technologies or disciplines (e.g., Office 365, Power BI, Azure Architect and Development exams, Cloud Platform Technologies, Information Security, Architecture).
* A few years experience with cloud and hybrid, or on premises infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, industry standards, and/or technology management.
* Proven years technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or technology delivery, or related experience OR equivalent experience.
* Experience and/or passion in these example technologies:
+ Cloud native architecture including microservices and containers, APIs, and serverless
+ Software development (e.g. .Net, Java, Python but also others)
+ AI development and integration (vision, text, small/large language models)
+ Integration services such as API gateways (API Management, Apigee, MuleSoft, Kafka) and event handling
+ GitHub and DevOps automation


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
   

  

 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Build Strategy**
* Works with account and marketing teams to shape strategic win and customer success plans and tailor Microsoft messaging to audience using knowledge of customer feedback, specific Microsoft solutions, and their context in a competitive landscape. Where applicable, builds consumption plans with Partner and Industry Solutions Delivery teams after customer sign-off.
* Captures core competitive knowledge and delivers back to product and engineering teams to enhance team capabilities and develop compete strategies for assigned customers.
* Provides strategic, technical, and partner input based on Microsoft capability at the account level to contribute to strategy development, leveraging partner, competitor, or open-source knowledge.


**Education**
* Monitors and responds to internal tech community posts, attends community calls, sessions, hackathons, etc., and acts as a mentor for their technology area.
* Demonstrates new and updated products to increase internal virtual teams' understanding of solutions and new opportunities.
* Builds their own readiness plan and proactively identifies learning gaps. Grows domain knowledge and practices expertise by communicating with customers, partners, and senior colleagues to expand knowledge of architecture.


**Scale Customer Engagements**
* Leverages foundational knowledge of resources (e.g., roles, Microsoft Technology Center [MTC], demo sites, virtual sites, Value Based Delivery [VBD], Customer Success Unit [CSU]) and proactively engages product teams (e.g., engineering) to remediate blockers by conveying impact.
* Engages with and reaches out to customers proactively and independently.
* Leads and ensures technical wins for core and adjacent technologies by leading technical discussions with customers and establishing rules of engagement (e.g., role boundaries, handoff strategies) for extended teams, leveraging knowledge of processes (e.g., Managed Service Provider [MSP], Managed Certified Professional [MCP]), tools, and programs (e.g., FastTrack, End Customer Investment Funds [ECIFs]). Searches for customer references to use in engagements.
* Uses knowledge of customer context, solution or portfolio expertise, and technical and industry knowledge to build credibility with customers.


**Solution Design and Proof**
* Presents and applies architecture patterns to partners or customers and drives cross-workload support for Microsoft Solutions.
* Applies sales methodologies (e.g., challenger sales) and coaches team in addressing customer digital transformation and leveraging insights to align new or changing technology to customer business needs.
* Demonstrates and oversees demonstrations (e.g., architectural design sessions, and proof of concept [POC] sessions) of products, services, and integration through initial engagements. Leverages partner/customer teams as needed to prove capabilities and integration into customer environment.


**Leverage Partner Ecosystem**
* Supports partner technical capacity by identifying skill and resource gaps and providing feedback to internal teams (e.g., Global Partner Solutions).
* Engages in partner sell-with scenarios by acting as liaison between the partner and team and facilitating partner resources and processes throughout the course of the project.

title: Product Owner
description:
*Vi söker en erfaren Product Owner som ska leda Betalningsteamet i projektet Transformation Företag och Lantbruk. Vill du vara med på en resa mot att forma framtidens försäkringslösningar och driva kundupplevelsen till nya höjder? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan idag!*
**Om jobbet**
 Transformation Företag och Lantbruk är en av länsförsäkringsgruppens stora satsningar i vår strävan att behålla positionen som Sveriges främsta försäkringsbolag inom företagssektorn.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Product Owner som ska leda det team som har ansvar för betalningshantering. Teamets uppgift är att driva en spännande resa mot ökad rörlighet och förbättrad kund- och medarbetarupplevelse inom betalningsområdet. Detta är en möjlighet att leda ett strategiskt viktigt område inom transformationen av företagsaffären, där du kommer att ha ägarskap för att etablera moderna processer rörande betalningar. Rollen är instrumentell i att löpande förvalta, optimera gemensamt arbetssätt runt betalningsprocesser och möjliggöra nyttoeffekter. Uppdraget spänner från att förenkla produkterna till digitalisering/automatisering av fakturering och betalningsprocesserna.
   

  

 I rollen som Product Owner kommer du agera processansvarig för de gemensamma betalningsprocesserna och det gemensamma arbetssättet, med en ambition om att löpande driva harmonisering av betalningsprocesser, betalningslösningar och betalningsintegrationer tillsammans med länsbolagen och övriga agila tåg inom Länsförsäkringar AB.
   

  

 Idag arbetar du kanske som gruppchef, tåglänk, förändringsledare eller införandeansvarig med bakgrund inom ekonomi/betalningshantering och önskar utveckla både ledarskap och affärsmanskap i en sådan roll. Denna roll kommer över tid ha en sådan tyngd att den är relevant också för dig som arbetar som chef eller RTE och vill anta en ny utmaning och samtidig påverka Länsförsäkringar AB:S strategiska utveckling med din erfarenhet.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden innebär att:
   

  

* Tillsammans med PM-rollen löpande utveckla och förtydliga produktvisionen och förmedla den på ett pedagogiskt sätt så att teamet förstår betalningsområdet samt tågets vision och målsättningar. Du blir Länsförsäkringar AB SAKs ”ambassadör och visionär” inom allt som rör betalningar och framtidens sätt att förenkla betalningar och säkerställa skalfördelar inom Länsförsäkringar AB gruppen på detta område.
* Utveckla rätt lösning utifrån en helhetssyn med utgångspunkt i omvärldens, kundernas och medarbetarnas framtida behov.
* Sammanställa teamets backlogg och ansvara för dess innehåll samt att den är uppdaterad.
* Stötta teamet i arbetet med att bryta ner prioriterade behov och önskemål i realiserbara och estimerade aktiviteter.
* Skapa förutsättningar för teamets medlemmar att aktivt ta ansvar för utvecklingen av betalningslösningar.
* I samarbete med teamet planera och genomföra möten och ceremonier samt driva PI-planning aktiviteter tillsammans med produktledningen.
* Verifiera kvalitet och affärsvärde för teamens leveranser, samt godkänna acceptans- och systemtest.
* Ansvara för att hantera kapacitet och teamets utvecklingshastighet.
* Främja agila principer, säkerställa hög kvalitet och kontinuerliga värdeleveranser.
* Etablera processägarskap och relevant monitorering och uppföljning via KPI:er och OKR:er som ger feedback och återkoppling om kundupplevelsen och handläggares upplevelser.
* Identifiera och driva ständig förbättring inom betalningsprocessen.


**Vem är du?**
 Krav:
   

  

* Du är nyfiken, framåtblickande och djärv som person, med ett lugn i att leda andra genom förändring och nytänkande.
* Bred affärskännedom inom försäkring, gärna med fokus på betalningsområdet inom privat eller företag.
* Erfarenhet av att leda ett team, gärna i en matrisorganisation.
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
* Din ambition är att ta dig an rollen i minst 24 månader innan du fortsätter din karriär inom Länsförsäkringar AB.


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda, genomföra och följa upp utvecklingsinitiativ.
* Vana av att vara i en roll där du behöver fatta beslut och välja väg framåt.
* Erfarenhet av värdeströmskartläggning, rotorsaksanalys och att facilitiera team i problemlösning och beslutsfattande.
* Erfarenhet av arbete i rollen som Product Owner eller liknande roll inom agil utveckling – om du inte har detta hjälper vi dig med utbildning och onboarding.
* Dokumenterad utbildning inom agilt arbetssätt och metodik, exempelvis SAFe. Även här hjälper vi dig med utbildning och onboarding om inte du har jobbat med SAFe eller agil utveckling tidigare.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet inom ADO (Azure DevOps) inklusive dashboard, diagram och rapportfunktionaliteter.


 Vidare har du ett starkt inre driv som innebär att du både på egen hand och tillsammans med andra får saker att gå framåt. Du tycker om att samarbeta och förstår vikten av att arbeta som ett team där allas kompetenser tas till vara. Du har förmodligen ägnat dig åt lagsport och strävar efter liknande teamkänsla i ditt team. Du är analytisk och har gärna en akademisk bakgrund, tänker affärsmässig och utgår från ett helhetstänk. Du trivs i en föränderlig roll där svaren inte är givna och kan snabbt anpassa dig till nya förutsättningar. Rollen utgår från Stockholm och vi föredrar att träffas och arbeta från kontoret på Gärdet. Om du inte bor i Stockholmstrakterna kräver rollen en del resor, i alla fall i början.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utmanande arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att vara med och påverka produkten och verksamhetens framtid. Vi värdesätter mångfald och ser fram emot att ta emot ansökningar från personer med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-24**

title: Product Owner
description:
*Vi söker en erfaren Product Owner med fokus på affärsutveckling som kommer att leda Skadeteamet i projektet Transformation Företag och Lantbruk. Vill du vara med på en resa mot att forma framtidens försäkringslösningar och driva kundupplevelsen till nya höjder? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan.*
**Om jobbet**
 Transformation Företag och Lantbruk är en av Länsförsäkringsgruppens stora satsningar i vår strävan att bli Sveriges främsta försäkringsbolag inom företagssektorn. Vi söker nu en Product Owner till vårt skadeteam som ska leda ett av våra produktteam i denna spännande resa mot ökad agilitet och förbättrad kund- och medarbetarupplevelse.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden innebär att:
   

  

* Formulera en tydlig produktvision och förmedla den på ett pedagogiskt sätt så att det hjälper teamet att förstå skadeområdet, tågets vision och målsättningar.
* Utveckla rätt lösning utifrån en helhetssyn med utgångspunkt i omvärldens, kundernas och medarbetarnas framtida behov.
* Sammanställa teamets backlogg och ansvara för dess innehåll samt att den är uppdaterad.
* Stötta teamet i arbetet med att bryta ner prioriterade behov/önskemål i realiserbara och estimerade aktiviteter.
* Skapa förutsättningar för tågets medlemmar att aktivt ta ansvar för utvecklingen.
* I samarbete med teamet planera och genomföra teamets möten/ceremonier samt driver PI-planning aktiviteter ihop med produktledningen.
* Verifiera kvalitet och affärsvärde för teamens leveranser, samt godkänna acceptans- och systemtest.
* Ansvara för att hantera kapacitet och teamets utvecklingshastighet.
* Främja agila principer, säkerställa hög kvalitet och kontinuerliga värdeleveranser.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har följande,
   

  

 Kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete i rollen som Product Owner eller liknande roll inom agil utveckling.
* Dokumenterad utbildning inom agilt arbetssätt och metodik, exempelvis SAFe.
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
* Bred affärskännedom inom sakförsäkring, gärna med fokus på skadeområdet och företags/lantbrukssegmentet.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda, genomföra och följa upp utvecklingsinitiativ


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet med ADO (Azure DevOps) inklusive dashboard, diagram och rapportfunktionaliteter.
* Erfarenhet av värdeströmskartläggning, rotorsaksanalys och att facilitiera team i problemlösning och beslutsfattande.


 Vidare har du ett starkt inre driv som innebär att du både på egen hand och tillsammans med andra får saker att gå framåt. Du tycker om att samarbeta och förstår på riktigt vikten av att arbeta som ett team där allas kompetenser tas till vara. Du är analytisk, affärsmässig och utgår från ett helhetstänk. Du trivs i en föränderlig roll där svaren inte är givna och kan snabbt anpassa dig till nya förutsättningar.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utmanande arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att vara med och påverka produkten och verksamhetens framtid. Vi värdesätter mångfald och ser fram emot att ta emot ansökningar från personer med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter.
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra gruppen Affärsutveckling Företag på AE Sak, Länsförsäkringar AB. Gruppen har i uppdrag att utveckla och förvalta Länsförsäkringsgruppens företagssakaffär i alla delar. Vi har medarbetare som arbetat en längre tid på Länsförsäkringar AB och de som är alldeles nya hos oss. Vår samlade kompetens och olika bakgrunder är vår stora styrka, tillsammans med ett stort driv för att utvecklas.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-24**

title: Test and Verification Project Manager
description:
****🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Test and Verification Project Manager🚀****
 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a
 ****Test and Verification Project Manager****
 . Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as
 **our Test and Verification Project Manager.**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Please think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Lead, develop, and drive the test strategy and verification plan for projects and product changes, from early phase testing to user acceptance testing—secure test equipment in the form of rigs and vehicles, as well as resources. Planning and follow-up are carried out in close collaboration with the verification and development teams.Playing an important part in the Project Management Team to secure quality-assured products.
   

  

 Presenting status and risks to PM board.
   

  

**Requirements**
 Minimum 8 years of experience as a Project Manager in development projects. Proven experience in leading and managing teams effectively. Excellent communication skills for cross-functional collaboration. Structured and organized approach to work. Ability to gather input from multiple areas and make sense of large amounts of information. Strong problem-solving skills and analytical thinking. Leadership skills to motivate, guide, and drive a team towards successful outcomes.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provide opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

**Apply Now Please feel free to reach me at** 
 sandhya@vipas.se
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Välkänt IoT bolag söker Data Engineer
description:
Ett ledande, Skandinaviskt företag inom IoT-tjänster med över 20 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med företag världen över söker dig som drivs av komplex datahantering som arbetat med stora dataflöden.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, långsiktigt
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Ett ledande, Skandinaviskt företag inom IoT-tjänster med över 20 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med företag världen över. Företag är en global ledare inom IoT och hanterar mer än 20 miljoner uppkopplingar för multinationella kunder som Volvo, Scania, Hitachi, Verisure, Securitas, Direct och Husqvarna.
 


  


 De erbjuder enkel och tillförlitlig tillgång till varje marknad världen över och möjliggör för branschledande aktörer att koppla upp sina produkter och tjänster på global skala över alla vertikaler.
 


  


 Företaget är rankat topp tre bästa IoT-operatörerna i Europa och bland de tio bästa i världen. Med huvudkontor och tekniskt centrum beläget i Norden har de försäljningsrepresentation i Storbritannien, USA, Tyskland, Italien, Sydafrika, Sydkorea, Kina, Taiwan och Japan.
 


  

  

**Tjänsten och teamet**
  


 Vi söker en erfaren Data Engineer med utmärkta färdigheter inom avancerad och modern databehandling av stora datamängder.
 


  


 Teamet du kommer vara en del av ansvarar för:
 


  

  
* Arkitektur och utveckling av dataplattform, inklusive insamling, bearbetning och förberedelse av data – både batch och realtidsdata.
  
* Utveckling av analysrapporter och verktyg.
  
* Utveckling och hantering av ML-modeller.
  
* Piloter och implementering av AI-användningsfall i produktion.
  
* Teamet har också ett DevOps-ansvar vilket innebär att "det vi bygger, det driftar vi också".
  


  


 Datateamet interagerar och levererar affärsvärde till nästan alla delar av organisationen. Teamet är också ansvarigt för att leverera direkt kundvärde, antingen genom att stödja kundnära kollegor eller via kundnära datalösningar. Detta är en fantastisk möjlighet att bli en del av ett moget och effektivt datateam med stor exponering mot den globala verksamheten.
   

 Denna roll rapporterar till Head of Data (Data Science and Analytics team) och är placerad i Stockholm, Karlskrona eller Göteborg.
   




**Vi söker dig som**

 För att lyckas i denna position ska du ha omfattande erfarenhet och färdigheter inom:
 


  

  
* Big data
  
* Utveckling inom Python eller Java
  
* Molnplattformar
  
* DevOps
  


  

  

**Andra krav**
  

  
* MSc i mjukvaru-/dataingenjör eller liknande
  
* Utmärkta skriftliga och muntliga kommunikationsfärdigheter på engelska och helst svenska
  


  


  

**Meriterande teknologier / frameworks**



  

  
* Big data teknologier som: Apache-frameworks (Iceberg, Flink, PySpark, etc)
  
* AWS services som: Glue, StepFunctions, Athen/Trino
  
* Verktyg för dataanalys/ML/AI: Pandas, etc
  


  


  

**Meriterande arbetsmetoder**



  

  
* CI/CD designmönster
  
* Dataorienterade testfall
  
* Hantering av referensdata
  
* Distribuerade arbetsbelastningar inklusive partitionsstrategier
  
* Skalbara databehandlingsmönster
  


  


 Stor vikt läggs vid erfarenhet av att hantera höga och växande datavolymer. Om man har varit en del av ett team som stött på skalningsproblem och löst det på ett innovativt sätt är det extra meriterande. Du bör också vara kunniga inom säker design och åtkomstmönster, och helst ha en AWS-certifiering.
 


  

  

  

  

  

  

**Som person**
  


 De söker en engagerad och självdriven person med en positiv och optimistisk inställning. Man ska inte vara rädd för att ta stort ansvar, vara affärsorienterad och bra med människor. Man ska älska att dela tekniskt kunnande och god praxis. Teamet delar en testdriven inställning och ett gemensamt intresse för att arbeta över flera miljöer och programmeringsspråk, utnyttjande av molnets krafter.
   

 Kunskap kan erhållas genom utbildning, erfarenhet eller att vara självlärd.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. title: Network Infrastructure Specialist
description:
### **Responsibilities**


* Take lead on design work for new solutions supporting business initiatives requiring new functions and services.
* Develop, build, and manage the Network, transforming our legacy network to network as a code with a service layer.
* Control that architectural policies and guidelines are followed and in accordance with roadmap.
* Provide technical engineering, best practices concerning the overall Network.
* Control that architectural policies and guidelines are followed and in accordance with roadmap.
* Analyze, design, develop and maintain roadmaps and implementation plans.
* Monitor performance, ensure availability, and reliability.
* Documentation of service design package and service description.
* Documentation of guidelines, processes, and routines.
* Setting and maintaining network standards.
* Being an advisor in Network design, plan, build and operate within the Network domain.
* Cooperate and coordinate with stakeholder’s contribution with Network knowledge to reach business needs.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, making recommendations as needed to help our company develop.
* Understand and visualize concepts that are not yet concrete, and use your problem-solving skills, strong analytic ability, creativity and customer and business drive to find a solution.
* See the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas.
* Take the initiative and are not afraid to take the first steps to identify and address existing and potential obstacles, issues, and opportunities.


**Required Skills**


* Network design and Network architecture.
* Deep knowledge and long experience in wireless advanced supporting services/platforms associated to wireless such as: Cisco ISE, Infoblox IPAM, wireless clients of all kinds Cisco Prime, Spaces, Wireless LAN controllers.
* Creating High, and low-level designs.
* Planning, design, and lifecycle management networks.
* Design and implementation of routing and switching in complex environment.
* The ability to understand business needs transforming them into design for new services or infrastructure functionalities.
* The ability to recognize structural issues within the organization, functional interdependencies and cross-silo redundancies and apply architectural principles to business solutions.
* An understanding about product development from ideation to release.
* Cloud networking and cloud connectivity solutions in a multicloud environment.
* Understanding of network security ((IPS, proxy, firewall, reverse-proxy, load balancing, VPN).
* Experience of micro segmentation and profiling.
* Good understanding of IP Networking, SDWAN, SD-LAN.
* Understanding of Network automation and programming (Scripting, python, ansible, Git etc.).
* Experience of working with APIs and system integrations.
* Knowledge of Cisco DevNet.
* Handling multivendor environment (e.g. Cisco, HPE).
* Hands-on experience with monitoring, network diagnostic and network analytics tools companies.
* CCNP or higher (CCIE/CISSP a plus).

title: Security - Go to Market (GTM) Manager
description:
***The Western Europe Security GTM provides strategic Leadership for high-impact go-to-market performance and drives best in class revenue growth for Microsoft’s Security Portfolio. You will become a key member of this high performing team as the GTM Manager for Sweden and contributing to the overall growth of the Western Europe Area.***

  



The Sales Enablement & Operations (SE&O) team plays an essential role in translating Microsoft’s Commercial Strategy to a local execution plan and driving operational excellence to achieve the greatest results possible. Our team drives cross-Region, cross-Area and cross-Subsidiary insight and execution excellence, bringing strategy and priorities to life by accelerating the pace of transformation and enabling Microsoft to deliver business impact at scale.

  

As the Go to Market (GTM) Manager for Security you will be responsible for providing business leadership for the Microsoft Security Business in the Swedish subsidiary. You will activate the seller community, engage in targeted marketing activity to drive sales and provide the required operational excellence to further grow the security business within Sweden. This opportunity will allow you to develop your end to end business skills by orchestrating many roles across the Microsoft field organization. You will learn how to operate successfully in a complex multinational environment and create mindshare for this high potential and high growth area.

  

We’re looking for a highly driven, motivated marketing and people leader to join our team. This role requires someone who thrives leading a team, acts as a thought leader, develops marketing strategy, and tracks success criteria and performance metrics. They will lead a team that works with emergent technology, excels at creating alignment and action across teams, moving roadblocks and simplifying complex concepts, truly lives for big challenges, and is not afraid to take thoughtful risks working in deep partnership with the field, Corp, and cross-functional marketing team. To be successful in the role you should be a thoughtful people leader and drive your team development for success through business impact. This role is flexible in that you can work up to up to 100% from home.

  

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.**Responsibilities**
--------------------


Drive Business Performance* Partners with Areas to drive GTM for aligned Solution Plays, identifying growth opportunities in the market and builds clear execution plans.
* Align, influence and coach field teams, sales operations, marketing plans, business rhythms and change management to convert strategic priorities into local execution.
* Partners across Microsoft core teams to bring the voice of field and co-design strategy and programs.


Leads Sales Enablement* Lands and champions solution plays, activating connected sales and marketing execution in every segment to maximize performance and share.
* Lead and collaborate with GPS for local partner-led marketing strategies and demand generation that support solution play performance.
* Champions Microsoft strategy and Solution Areas and builds industry presence.


Champions Product Advocacy* Advocates as the voice of the Customer, Partners and Field to provide thought leadership on competitive landscape, solution area gaps, sales trends, etc. to drive improvements on the Go-To-Market (GTM) plan.
* Grows organization capability to drive true insights, learnings and blockers for leaders, managers, and sellers.
* Drives standardized rhythms and tools that drive increased customer and partner facing time for sellers.
* Activates leaders and managers on investments and resource optimization, leveraging data and analysis.

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Required/Minimum Qualifications (RQs/MQs)*** Extensive, proven marketing strategy, business planning, sales enablement, business development OR related work experience.
* Full proficiency in Swedish AND English is a must.

**Additional or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)*** Solid recent experience working with cloud security products and services. Strong knowledge of cybersecurity landscape and cybersecurity and data security fundamental concepts and models (e.g. Zero Trust, SASE).
* Extensive experience managing and expanding a product/solution portfolio and driving demand generation and pipeline acceleration within a complex (e.g., multinational or matrixed) organization.  

Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Experienced Test Engineer - Axis Body Worn Solutions
description:
Job Title
Experienced Test Engineer - Axis Body Worn Solutions
Job Description*We’re seeking an experienced test engineer to join our team and contribute to the development and quality of innovative wearable technology solutions at our HQ in Lund, Sweden. If you're looking for a new challenge within one of the region’s largest Quality Assurance organizations, this could be the perfect fit for you!*
Who is your future team?
You’ll be joining a team of dedicated and talented QA engineers working with Body Worn solutions. The team works closely with the software development group, collaborating to ensure the release of high-quality solutions. These solutions include embedded products, applications, and cloud technologies. You can find more information about our Body Worn solutions here.
What you’ll do here as an experienced Test engineer?
We are looking for a new team member who will help expand our automated test coverage, continuously improve testing tools, and perform manual exploratory tests.
Key responsibilities include:* Developing and implementing both functional and non-functional test cases
* Planning and executing tests
* Tool development and optimization
* Analyzing test results
* Developing and enhancing environments, methods, and processes


Who are we looking for?
We’re looking for someone who is dedicated to quality and driven to contribute to an outstanding customer experience. You thrive on problem-solving and are always seeking more efficient testing methods. You also have the ability to see the bigger picture while delivering continuous incremental improvements.
You enjoy working in close collaboration with other colleagues and sharing knowledge. Your contribution to strong teamwork is important, both within and across teams.
In this role, it’s important that you have strong communication skills and are able to clearly convey information about quality to different stakeholders.
We'd love to hear that you have/are:* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
* Solid experience in software testing
* Knowledge of network communication
* Proficiency in Python


Nice to have:* Experience working in a Linux environment
* Familiarity with data collection or log management systems


What Axis have to offer
One of our greatest assets is our focus on collaboration. We also know that good ideas can come anytime and anywhere and therefore we encourage everyone to contribute and be innovative. If you are a person who likes to make a difference, you will feel right at home with us!
The well-being of the employees is essential to us. We work actively with our culture where team spirit, equal opportunities for all and having fun are central parts. We want you to enjoy working with us! Therefore, we offer great benefits, e.g. flexible working hours, breakfast every day, classic Swedish fika on Fridays, corporate bonus, physical training grants, insurances, your very own Axis bicycle – just to name a few.
Ready to Act?
If this opportunity sparks your interest and you’d like to learn more, don’t hesitate to send in your application! For any specific questions, feel free to reach out to the hiring manager, Louise Relkman, at +46 46 272 19 96.
The hiring process is a two-way street: it’s just as important for you to get to know your potential colleagues, manager, and the culture at Axis as it is for us to learn about you. After all, we want to make sure we succeed together!
Please note that applications will be handled continuously, so don’t wait to apply!
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2024-11-05*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.

title: Major Account Manager
description:
Flexera saves customers billions of dollars in wasted technology spend. A pioneer in Hybrid ITAM and FinOps, Flexera provides award-winning, data-oriented SaaS solutions for technology value optimization (TVO), enabling IT, finance, procurement and cloud teams to gain deep insights into cost optimization, compliance and risks for each business service. Flexera One solutions are built on a set of definitive customer, supplier and industry data, powered by our Technology Intelligence Platform, that enables organizations to visualize their Enterprise Technology Blueprint™ in hybrid environments—from on-premises to SaaS to containers to cloud.
We’re transforming the software industry. We’re Flexera. With more than 50,000 customers across the world, we’re achieving that goal. But we know we can’t do any of that without our team. Ready to help us re-imagine the industry during a time of substantial growth and ambitious plans? Come and see why we’re consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester and IDC as a category leader in the marketplace. Learn more at flexera.com
Major Account Manager
The Product
Ideal for organizations with highly complex hybrid environments, Flexera One is a SaaS-based IT management solution that visualizes your entire IT estate, from on-premises to SaaS to the cloud, so you can make game-changing IT decisions—all from a single user interface.
Solutions that provide a system of IT insight:* IT Asset Management - transforms technology data into actionable intelligence, empowering IT to effectively manage, govern and optimize their hybrid IT estate. With the right asset data, you can discover software and hardware, reduce risk and spend through optimization and control shadow IT.
* Cloud Migration and Modernization - having full visibility into applications across the IT landscape and their interdependencies provides the needed foundation to make sound cloud transformation decisions and operate cloud at scale.
* Cloud Cost Optimization (FinOps) - get a comprehensive set of cloud cost optimization capabilities designed to implement FinOps processes across your entire cloud environment. Flexera's CCO works with all cloud service providers, including Azure, Google Cloud, AWS, and less common/region specific providers.
* IT Visibility - Consolidate, normalize and contextualize IT data for strategic use. Improve ITSM and ITFM with information from our Technopedia catalog and identification—the only curated source that helps fix CMDB data quality issues. Feed IT business systems with holistic IT data that links business services with resources, cost, usage and risk.


The Role
The Major Account Manager will sell the Flexera One platform to a list of Public Sector accounts across the Nordic region. You will be responsible for meeting and exceeding annual quota through execution of sales strategies, utilization of innovative business development techniques and accurate forecasting.*Responsibilities:** Prospect across a broad range of accounts to build high-quality pipeline
* You will develop and run a sales strategy with a target account list
* You will be responsible for building and developing account relationships through personalized contact, understanding of the customer's needs, and ability to effectively communicate the value of Flexera’s solutions
* Lead sales campaigns and motions that build customer value and enable multi-year, multi-solution transactions
* Accurately forecast opportunities based upon realistic assessments and consistently deliver against that forecast
* Negotiation of pricing and contractual agreements to close the sale
* Work with channel and alliance partners on joint opportunities
* Development and maintenance of relationships in named accounts where applicable

*Qualifications & Experience:** Experience in selling Software solutions (Cloud, cloud cost, cloud management, ITSM, ITAM/SAM, data, security, risk management software, application resource management)
* Experience utilizing a defined Sales Methodology (re: MEDDPICC, MEDDIC, Challenger, etc.) for business needs/business pain understanding
* Successful in finding and uncovering opportunities with net new and existing accounts, via creative prospecting tactics and hunting activities
* Full ownership of the end-to-end sales process (this is not an overlay role)
* Strong reputation for exceeding sales quota
* Consultative sales experience targeting relevant companies/businesses to drive cost savings and efficiencies throughout their IT organization
* Highly motivated and professional, with excellent verbal communication, presentation, and social skills
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience


#LI-REMOTE
#LI-JP2
#sales
Flexera is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered for open roles regardless of age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local/national laws, policies and/or regulations.
Flexera understands the value that results from employing a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce. We recognize that equity necessitates acknowledging past exclusion and that inclusion requires intentional effort. Our DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) council is the driving force behind our commitment to championing policies and practices that foster a welcoming environment for all.
We encourage candidates requiring accommodations to please let us know by emailing careers@flexera.com.
