title: Sales Operations Executive
description:
**Sales Operations Executive**
 London, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Stockholm, Oslo or Sofia
 



**Puzzel: The Low-Down** 
**🔍** 




 Puzzel is a leading provider of cloud-based contact center solutions, empowering businesses to deliver exceptional customer service. Our platform combines omnichannel contact center, workforce management, and AI-driven analytics to optimize customer interactions and operational efficiency.
 



 With 25 years’ experience since our foundation in Norway, we’re already #1 in the Nordics, growing rapidly in the UK and expanding into the Netherlands and Finland in 2024, but our ambition is to become the clear European market-leader in the coming years 🚀
 



**Why we’re proud** 



* 2024 CX Awards Winner, ‘Best Mid-Market Contact Center Platform’
* Puzzel was recognised as the 'most innovative European-founded CCaaS provider' and top 3 globally by Frost & Sullivan in 2023
* Best Practices Company of the Year 2023
* Consistently high Glassdoor rating
* 2023 customer NPS score of 37
* Puzzel places high importance on work-life balance and flexible working hours - as recognised by Flexa, placing 25
 th 
 out of all companies they partner with in 2023!
* We are working with Mercer on salary benchmarking, to ensure pay equality and market competitiveness



**Key Data Points** 



* €50m revenue in FY 2023 (up from €45m in 2022)
* Currently ~295 employees
* Used by more than 1100 businesses across 40 countries
* Servicing ~60,000 customer service agents on a daily basis + 800 million customer interactions yearly



**What you'll do** 
**🏡💻** 




 As a Sales Operations Executive at Puzzel, you will work closely with the VP Sales – New Business and CRO on reporting for new business deals, pipeline management and forecasting.
 



 You will use Salesforce & Excel (plus potentially some visualisation tools) to report on sales’ performance, tracking KPIs such as time to conversion, average deal size which will be used by senior management in board meetings.
 



 Reporting into our Revenue Operations Manager in Sweden, you will work alongside 2 x Deal Desk Analysts + 1 Salesforce Administrator. You should be a confident communicator, comfortable liaising with all levels across the business.
 



**Key elements:** 




**Dashboards and Reporting:** 
 Create and maintain comprehensive dashboards to track key sales metrics and performance indicators. Provide actionable insights and identify trends on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis. Monitor metrics for any anomalies or downward trends, flagging potential issues promptly.
 



**Insights and Performance Analysis:** 
 Analyze sales data to derive insights that inform strategic decisions. Highlight findings to Head of Revenue Operations and suggest improvements based on performance data.
 



**Pipeline Governance:** 
 Collaborate closely with Deal Desk and Sales Leadership to ensure accurate and up-to-date pipeline management, maintain a healthy sales pipeline and ensure data integrity.
 



**License Management and Product Ownership:** 
 Oversee license management for sales tools, ensuring proper allocation and utilization. Act as a product owner for sales tools, driving enhancements and ensuring they meet the needs of the sales team.
 



**Commissions and Spiff Management:** 
 Administer and manage commission plans and spiff programs, ensuring accurate calculations and timely payments. Collaborate with finance to ensure alignment with company policies and objectives.
 



**Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Work closely sales leadership, marketing operations, sales operations, customer success operations and product operations, to ensure cohesive operations and strategic alignment. Support sales leadership with ad-hoc projects and strategic initiatives as needed.
 



**Support for Functional Requests:** 
 Provide support to stakeholders by facilitating resolutions to operational issues and guiding them to appropriate resources. Act as a point of contact for sales team members needing assistance with tools, processes, or other sales-related matters.
 



**The must haves** 
**💪** 



* Confident English speaker, comfortable working with senior stakeholders within the business in multiple countries.
* Salesforce (dashboard and report creation)
* Familiarity with sales pipeline management / quote-to-cash processes
* Intermediate Excel skills (Pivots, V-lookups etc)
* Data driven, analytical mindset, comfortable with utilising data to report on sales performance.
* Experience within a Sales Operations/Sales Analyst/Revenue Operations type role.
* Analytical & innovative mindset to question and improve current processes.
* Strong English - confident and able to challenge and ask questions to all stakeholders.
* Commercially/revenue minded.



**The nice to haves** 
**➕➕➕** 



* SaaS experience within a B2B company
* PowerBI or other reporting/visualization tools
* Previous experience directly in sales
* Any experience with Clari suite



**The location** 




 This role can be located in the UK (London preferably), Copenhagen, Stockholm or Oslo, with expectation of roughly 2 days/week in the office.
 



**What’s In it for You?** 
**💰** 



* Competitive salary
* Flexible, hybrid approach to working; split your time between the office and home
* You get to be part of a fun, driven and supportive team
* Gift on your birthday
* Annual Summer and Christmas parties
* Excellent development opportunities and a great company culture



**What to expect from the interview process** 
**❔** 



* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* 1
 st 
 interview with Revenue Operations Manager
* Technical test
* Informal chat with new VP Sales
* Final interview with RevOps Manager and Chief of Staff



**Puzzel Values** 
**🎯** 



* **Built on Trust –** 
 trust is an intrinsic Nordic value, upon which Puzzel has been built. We trust each other and our customers and partners trust us.
* **Stronger Together –** 
 working together in a genuinely collaborative way, with a shared purpose, we have an empowered organisation that is better equipped to delight customers and partners.
* **Stay Hungry –** 
 have a continuous hunger to raise our game, innovate and be the best we can be professionally.



**Diversity & Inclusion** 
**🌍** 




 We want everyone at Puzzel to be their true, authentic selves at work irrespective of nationality, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical ability, age, or economic background.
 



 Whilst we are proud to already have a diverse workforce from across the globe, we are aware that things could always be improved – for example, we currently have a ratio of female 26:74 male employees, which whilst not uncommon for the tech industry (average in SaaS is 26% female), it’s far from ideal. So, what are we doing to improve this?
 


* Our Global Leadership Team (C-suite) has shifted from 100% male to 50 male: 50 female in the past 18 months.
* We have increased our % of female hires from 23.6% in 2021 to 38.5% in 2023.
* We are partnering with the likes of Flexa, who have significantly higher-than-average talent pools of candidates from diverse backgrounds.
* We are working with State Employment initiatives in Norway and Sweden to bring candidates through internship/apprenticeship routes and are investigating similar initiatives in the UK and Bulgaria.
* By raising awareness and transparency, we are hoping to further attract a diverse workforce.



 We are continuously striving to foster an inclusive and diverse environment, where everyone is celebrated for who they are. If there is anything we can do to support you in the interview process, or beyond, please let us know.
 



**One Last Thing** 
**☝** 
**🏻** 




 Even if you feel you are only a 75% match for this role, we still want to hear from you. This list is purely indicative. Skills can always be learnt.
 



 Please note that we are not able to provide sponsorship for this role, so you must have eligibility to work in the country you are applying for.
 



*By applying you accept the terms of our Privacy Notice which can be found on our website. Puzzel are not considering candidates that do not have a work permit in the country we are hiring in.*

title: Infrastructure Engineer – Generative AI on Microsoft Azure
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Financial Services
description:
**Infrastructure Engineer – Generative AI on Microsoft Azure**




  





 Our innovative client is looking for a dynamic and experienced Infrastructure Engineer to help shape the future of generative AI by designing, building, and maintaining cutting-edge infrastructure on the Microsoft Azure platform.
 



  





 In this exciting role, you’ll be at the forefront of technological advancements, collaborating with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate critical infrastructure components, while implementing the latest in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) best practices using powerful tools like Terraform and Ansible.
 



  





 You'll have the opportunity to manage complex network protocols and ensure secure data transmission for high-performance systems, while developing advanced monitoring and alerting mechanisms to keep the infrastructure running at peak efficiency. With your expertise, you'll automate processes through scripting in Bash, Python, or Shell, and lead the design of scalable, containerised environments using Docker and Kubernetes to support next-gen AI applications.
 



  





 If you're a proven Infrastructure Engineer with a passion for IaC, cloud platforms like Microsoft Azure, and containers like Docker and Kubernetes, this is your chance to make a real impact. Your strong scripting skills and in-depth knowledge of networking and security will be key to success in this role.
 



  





 This is a full-time, freelance position with long-term potential, offering the perfect chance to join a forward-thinking team and work on cutting-edge AI projects.
 



  





**Interviews are happening this week, so apply now and take the next step in your career!**

title: Technology Management Consultant
job_function: Consulting, Project Management, and Information Technology
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Strategic Management Services
description:
*Would you like to work on business-critical tech transformation projects at some of Sweden’s most reputable companies? Do you have experience advising clients on technical solutions? Then we want to know more about you!* 




  





**Your role** 




  





 As a BearingPoint consultant, you will be working on various projects delivering high-value insights to our clients. Our Technology Team advises business leaders and offers services such as tech transformation, agile project management, change management, procurement, IT sourcing, process automation, and other assignments spanning from high-level strategic advisory to client-side management of systems implementation. In your work, you will utilize your project management skills to bridge gaps between business and technology departments across various industries.
 



  





 Together with an ambitious and multidisciplinary team of colleagues, you will help our clients understand their current situation, risks, and opportunities and advise how they can use technology to solve their business needs. The type of projects will be varied, and you will have access to experts throughout our international community of consultants.
 



  





 Your professional and personal growth will be supported by a Development Manager. As you deepen your expertise and grow as a consultant, you will take on greater responsibilities in our client engagements and our internal business activities. Such as team development, employer branding, putting together new offerings, pitching to clients and other activities.
 



  





**What we are looking for in our new colleagues** 




  





 As an applicant, you understand business processes and have experience working with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) or other business applications used to support various internal functions.
 



 You should have some experience in one of our service areas mentioned above. Prior consulting experience is preferable but not necessary. We also expect you to hold a master's degree in business, Engineering, IT Management, Information Systems or other deemed relevant.
 



  





 To collaborate well and effectively with a wide range of people, you must enjoy working with others to achieve common goals, and as a colleague, you are reliable and show generosity to those around you. You also have a growth mindset and strong analytical skills. The most important is who you are as a person. If you fit the description regardless of seniority level, do not hesitate to send us your application!
 



  





 Additionally, to aid day-to-day business activities, some familiarity with using Excel and PowerPoint is to be desired. As we manage projects and advise clients in both the private and public sectors, it´s a requirement that you have excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English (spoken and written).
 



  





**What we offer** 




  





 BearingPoint is a great place to work. We can offer you the opportunity to work for a company with a global reach and a unique culture that allows everyone to reach their highest potential. We also offer team-specific competency development opportunities and employee benefits such as:
 



  





 • Professional and personal growth, supported by your Development Manager.
 



 • An international, dynamic, and inspiring work environment.
 



 • A steep learning curve in client-facing roles with a high impact on the business performance of our clients.
 



 • Competitive compensation and benefits package including but not limited to an occupational pension, health insurance, 5000 SEK wellness grant, expanded parental benefits, and more.
 



 • Competency development opportunities include our First 1000-day program and other Nordic & Firm-wide training and boot camps. For advanced leadership training opportunities, we have unique partnerships with Yale and Oxford universities (Grow with BearingPoint).
 



 • An annual curriculum of various social events and sports activities.
 



  





**What now?** 




  





 Send us your resume in either Swedish or English, and we´ll get back to you shortly. A cover letter is optional, and Interviews will be held continuously. During the interview process, you will meet various colleagues and conduct case interviews.
 



  





 Want to find out more about the team? Meet some of our colleagues here (Meet our Sweden team | BearingPoint Sweden).
 



  





**About BearingPoint** 




  





*BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and a global reach. The company operates in three business units: Consulting, Products, and Capital. Consulting covers the advisory business with a clear focus on selected business areas. Products provide IP-driven digital assets and managed services for business-critical processes. Capital delivers M&A and transaction services.* 




  





*BearingPoint’s clients include many of the world’s leading companies and organizations. The firm has a global consulting network with more than 13,000 people and supports clients in over 70 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success. For more information, please visit: https://www.bearingpoint.com/en-se/* 




  





*Together, we are more than business. We are a strongly purpose-driven organization, both today and as we forge our way into the future. Learn more about our purpose and values here.*

****Required cloud certification:****
 good to have

**Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.
   

 Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.**

title: Data architecture and engineering
description:
Join OX2 and use your skills to power the great shift towards a sustainable future. OX2 is a professional and ambitious company committed to accelerating access to renewable energy to speed up the transition to clean energy. We are multi-specialists to the core, offering a dynamic and inspiring workplace that enables seamless, cross-functional collaboration to achieve optimal results. At OX2 we empower you to take action, giving you the freedom and accountability to make great things happen and make a lasting impact.
 



  





 OX2’s IT organization is growing, and we are now hiring a Data Engineer to be part of the exciting journey that we have ahead of us and to be a key player in the transformation of our global data and analytics landscape.
 



  





**About the position** 




 OX2 has been expanding geographically into new markets as well as through offering new energy solutions to our markets. This has necessitated reviewing and developing OX2’s Way of working along with supporting the business with new, innovative and more fit-for-purpose solutions.
 



 We are looking for an experienced Data Architect and Engineer to be a key driving force in the transformation of our global data and analytics landscape. You will be part of a great and highly skilled IT function and will be located in Stockholm. You will be part of a growing Data and AI team and will report to the Data and Analytics Manager.
 



  





 In this position you will take a central role in redesigning our data and analytics set-up. New critical platforms are currently being implemented to support evolving business needs, and you will be at the centre of this journey, developing and executing on our data strategy covering ingestion, transformation, storage and to make data accessible and consumable in different solutions. Together with the team and our business colleagues you ensure that we have the right solutions for the purpose; weather it is to visualize data embedded in our business systems, build dashboards, reports and analytical capabilities or leveraging the latest advances in machine learning and AI.
 



  





 You work in close collaboration with Product owners, Process owners and Experts and other business representatives across OX2 to inspire and identify opportunities. Together with the team and through our partners you secure that we deliver robust services to our users, and you will play a key role to make OX2 more data driven and propelling business efficiency through use of AI.
 



  





**Your responsibilities will include:** 



* Data architecture design, where you are responsible for designing and implementing OX2’s data management framework, including data models, databases and data warehouses to meet business requirements
* Building and maintaining Data pipelines. Design, develop and manage robust data pipelines to ensure smooth data flow from various data sources to our data warehouse
* Data integration and transformation. Implement ETL processes ensuring accurate ready-to-use data for analytics
* Ensuring data Security and Compliance by implementing measures to protect data integrity, confidentiality and compliance with relevant regulatory requirements
* Optimizing Data infrastructure by analyzing and improving existing systems to ensure efficient data handling and storage
* Develop data management processes by implementing procedures to ensure data accessibility, accuracy and consistency across organization
* Overview the Power BI Development and enable data for report development
* Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in Azure services, Power BI and other tools
* Advise Process owners and Experts and other business stakeholders in Data and Analytics matters



  





**Sound like you?** 




 We want to hire someone who has genuine interest and documented experience in leading architectural design and implementation work within Data and Analytics and has a solid understanding of data and analytics tools. As a Data Architect and Engineer you have a key role in realizing and further developing OX2's strategies in the area. In addition, you have:
 



  




* Earlier working experience from similar roles as Data architect and/or Data engineer
* Several years of experience working with data modelling, data storage solutions and analytics tools, and in particular experience from working with Azure data warehouse and Power BI,
* Also proficient in data integration, data structures, data pipelines and data management in the cloud, SQL and Python
* Good business understanding and ability to understand Business processes and how systems can improve the everyday work life of the user, by making systems/solutions simpler and/or more efficient.
* Project management skills
* Relevant education such as Computer science and System administration
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Swedish



  





 We attach great importance to personal qualities and are looking for you who have high ability to take initiatives, high driving capability and sense of responsibility for your own work. You are service minded and have strong interpersonal skills and enjoys working with a wide range of contacts. You are structured and able to understand the details as well as seeing the greater picture. The successful candidate will have a positive attitude, are pedagogical and have good communication skills.
 



  





**Does this sound interesting? We welcome your application!** 




 If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Charlotta Skogar at charlotta.skogar@novare.se or 0761-66 48 78. Interviewing is taking place continuously so please send your application as soon as possible.

title: Senior Cloud Solution Architect till Sogeti
description:
**Brinner du för molnteknologi och gillar att stödja och utveckla verksamheters molnkompetens?**
 Som konsult hos Sogeti kommer du vara en brygga mellan affärsbehov och tekniska lösningar i arkitekturen hos kund. Utformar övergången av applikationer och data till molnet samt applikationsutveckling i molnet.
   

  

 Vårt kompetensområde inom Cloud tillåter dig att växa och ta plats, ta del av spännande dragningar från våra egna experter worldwide och våra partners. Så ta klivet uppåt på din Cloud-karriär och ta plats på Sogeti!
   

  

 Vi har Cloud-kompetens över hela landet och idag arbetar ca 200 Sogetiare med teknologier såsom Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform och IBM Cloud. Globalt finns förstås många fler Cloud-experter att lära av och samarbeta med.
   

  

**Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av...**
* Vi ser gärna att du har minst 5 års erfarenhet som Cloud Solution Architect
* Analysera affärsbehov
* Rekommendera migrationsvägar och anpassade molnlösningar
* Samarbeta med IT-utvecklingsteam för eftermigreringsprestanda och kompatibilitet
* Underlätta kommunikationen mellan tekniska och icke-tekniska team
* Förädla kraven till klara att utveckla tekniska episka/funktioner
* Identifiera tekniska beroenden från molninitiativ mot centralt hanterade molntjänster
* Utmärkta förmågor inom intressenthantering och kommunikation
* Kunskap om molnplattformar och tjänster
* Förmåga att anpassa tekniska lösningar med affärsmål
* Erfarenhet av att arkitektera molnmigrationskartor
* Erfarenhet av migrationsverktyg och metoder
* Kunskap om virtualisering och applikationsarkitekturer
* Förväntas ha certifieringar som Azure Solutions Architect Expert, AWS Certified Solutions Architect.
* Du ska ha en mycket god kommunikationsförmåga och du behärskar både svenska och engelska i tal så väl som skrift.


**Sogeti erbjuder karriärsmässig utveckling, balans i arbetslivet, goda förmåner och fokus på hälsa.**
 När vi frågar våra anställda varför de jobbar på Sogeti svarar de ofta "Möjligheterna!". Möjligheterna att kombinera ständigt lärande, internationella sammanhang, och familj/jobb-balans. Lika ofta nämner de den goda stämningen, de grymma kollegerna och den ständiga variationen av arbetsuppgifter. Ingen dag är den andra lik, men ett är säker, digital innovation är det bästa vi vet!
   

  

 Läs mer om hur på Livet på Sogeti är som IT -konsult!
   

  

**Vi vill fortsätta att växa, så ansök till oss idag och följ med på vår resa.**

title: Northern Europe Technology Development Lead (R-16409)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,500+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Northern Europe Technology Development Lead will be responsible for the strategy, ownership and delivery for a number of our key Local Markets (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Estonia and Latvia). This role is the pivotal partner for our business units in the segment on those markets, understanding the Business initiatives, potential opportunities and Technology requirements and owning the delivery from Technology to meet those Business Objectives.
   

  

 In addition to delivering for our business units, this role will be responsible for the modernization of the local markets within Northern Europe. Understanding the Technology platforms and organizational structure and defining the strategies for modernizing those platforms and bringing them together. D&B is growing rapidly within the Northern Europe markets and as a result we are looking for a Leader who can continue to drive and evolve our platforms to keep pace with this growth.
   

  

 Owning the strategy, approach and outcomes for these markets will be challenging as each local market has its own Business Deliverables, challenges and platforms to modernize. This will require a comprehensive mix of Technology skills, primarily as a leader you will need to define and drive the North Star for the Northern Europe markets. This will require heavy strategic thinking and direction, coupled with the fact that there is a large and complex delivery book of work. This role will be owning all of this and tracking/driving these markets and the programmes within them, so programme management and governance is imperative. Understanding and managing the cost base for the area will require good budget management capabilities, with the incumbent responsible for the budget, delivery within it and driving innovation to deliver more efficiently.
   

  

 Our platforms underpin some of the more complex businesses in Northern Europe and so require good knowledge of cloud-based technologies, microservices and high availability platforms. Finally excellent communication and stakeholder skills are required as the incumbent will be expected to provide domain management and updates to the full Northern Europe team.
   

  

 This role is fundamental for D&B International. Reporting into Senior Director Local Markets Europe and working close to the Senior Director Technology Development Strategic Products Europe you will be responsible for one of our largest and most complex markets, and to ensure that they continue to be successful whilst managing the modernization of Technology with zero impact to each market.
   

  

 This role will ensure that D&B can meet the needs of our ever-growing set of clients, products and data so it is a vital portion of our Technology transformation.
   

  

 Delivering on those technical commitments to meet our commercial objectives and responsible for keeping the European Leadership Team and other stakeholders updated on progress.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Overall E2E ownership for the Technology Functions within the Northern Europe Markets.
* Stakeholder management for the Northern Europe markets, representing Technology in the Northern Europe Leadership team and representing the markets for Technology.
* Working in partnership with the Local Market Leads, define, track and manage these projects to ensure delivery to budget and committed timelines.
* Develop the strategy and process for modernizing the Northern Europe markets, including product, resourcing and back office.
* Develop the vendor and location strategies for the domain, looking to utilize Technology centers in addition to the local market resource.
* Ensuring SLAs, metrics and continuous improvement measures are in place and can be demonstrated.
* Manage a significant domain budget, understanding, challenging, and proactively managing their cost and time position to mitigate potential delays and identify efficiencies.
* Identify any dependencies, risks and issues and ensure mitigation plans in place.
* Work closely with regional representatives from multiple global teams to ensure an effective cross-functional approach.
* Act as pivotal connection between the Technology delivery team and the commercial business to ensure requirements and timelines are understood and aligned.
* Coach, develop and challenge project teams (direct reports or otherwise) to a successful implementation.
* Effectively communicate timely and relevant updates to multiple stakeholder groups including International Technology and the European Leadership Team


**Key Attributes**
* Proven track record of leading a major Technology programme across multiple countries as a senior project director or lead preferably within a large organization.
* Strong project management and organizational skills with experience of managing complex projects and performance management of suppliers.
* Strong Technology background – knowledge of agile delivery practices, large scale data platforms and Java
* Ability to define and implement KPI’s around quality, efficiency and delivery for large distributed scrum teams.
* Exceptional multi-tasker, strategic and tactical thinker
* Ability to prioritize and adapt while maintaining the highest attention to detail.
* Able to shape, lead and control the delivery of complex, cross-functional projects, including optimization of resources and delivery to challenging timescales.
* Relationship management, able to build and maintain effective working relationships and work collaboratively with a wide range of colleagues.
* Understanding of relevant data legislation and privacy compliance across Europe


**Skills**
* 10+ years of experience of Leadership experience relating to critical Domains or Programmes.
* Extensive project management skills with a focus on business-centric projects
* Ability to develop governance methodologies as an integral part of successful program execution.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of leaders, managers, and subject matter experts.
* Able to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
* Demonstrable skills in presenting information effectively and delivering effective reporting mechanisms.
* Able to produce high quality, effective and thorough documentation.
* Able to manage and prioritize competing requirements.
* Fluent in Swedish and English language


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants : Please be advised that this job posting page is hosted and powered by Lever. Your use of this page is subject to Lever's Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy , which governs the processing of visitor data on this platform.

title: Infrastructure Engineer - Generative AI on Microsoft Azure
description:
Our leading customer is seeking an experienced Infrastructure Engineer to design, build, and maintain infrastructure for generative AI applications on the Microsoft Azure platform. In this role, the successful candidate will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of infrastructure components and implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) best practices using tools such as Terraform and Ansible.
   

  

 Responsibilities will include managing network protocols and secure data transmission while developing monitoring and alerting mechanisms to maintain optimal infrastructure performance. The engineer will also write scripts in Bash, Python, or Shell to automate tasks and design containerised environments using Docker and Kubernetes for scalable deployment of AI applications.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you should be a proven Infrastructure Engineer focused on IaC. Proficiency in Microsoft Azure, Docker, and Kubernetes is required, alongside strong Scripting skills and a solid understanding of networking and security practices.
   

  

 This role is a full-time, freelance position with strong long-term prosperity.
   

  

**This is an excellent opportunity for a passionate individual eager to contribute to innovative AI projects within a dynamic team environment. Interviews are being arranged for this week so please apply now!**

title: Konsultchef inom Mjukvaru- och Systemutveckling
description:
**Job Description**
 Söker du en arbetsplats där du dagligen får utmanas och utvecklas inom entreprenörskap, ledarskap och ingenjörskap? Då är Sigma Industry Development rätt företag för dig.
   

  

 Sigma Industry Development är ett dotterbolag inom SIEN-koncernen som fortsätter sin framgångsrika tillväxtresa utan att tumma på kvalitet. Två år i följd har pris vunnits som ett av Sveriges bäst välskötta företag, samt topp10-ranking i medarbetartrivsel på nationell nivå. Med andra ord är manegen krattad för fortsatta framgångar och arbetsglädje.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en konsultchef till sektionen Mekatronik. Sektionen utgörs idag av 13 ingenjörer inom AI, mjukvaru- och hårdvaruutveckling, test och verifiering. Du kommer ha fördelen att ansluta dig till en etablerad kundbas, men ha fria tyglar att sätta din prägel på verksamheten och dess framtida strategi, samtidigt som teamet vill utvecklas genom ditt ledarskap och målsättningar.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
 Din uppgift är att hjälpa teamet och verksamheten att utvecklas ytterligare, genom att navigera mot hög tillväxt och säkerställa nya affärer. Din roll är mångfacetterad där du kommer arbetar med att anställa de bästa talangerna och utveckla dessa, samtidigt som du brinner för affärsutveckling där målet är att etablera nya kundsamarbeten och driver in de stora affärerna. Detta utan att varken köra slut på ditt bränsle eller skada den goda (arbets-) miljön.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet från försäljning och ledarskap i konsultbranschen, samt ett brett nätverk i Stockholmsregionen och du är en person som inte bara snackar utan gillar att få saker att hända.
   

  

**Utbildning**
* MSc i Datavetenskap, Mekatronik, Teknisk fysik, eller liknande utbildningsbakgrund eller har förvärvat motsvarande kunskap genom flera års erfarenhet inom området.


**Erfarenhet inom**
* Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av ledarskap och försäljning inom konsultbranschen, särskilt inom mjukvaru- och systemutveckling.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och leda team samt utveckla långsiktiga kundrelationer.


**Språkkunskap**
* Svenska och engelska, flytande i tal och skrift (båda är krav för anställning)


**Preferred Additional Skills, Personal Traits And Experience**
 Om AI har en speciell plats i ditt ingenjörshjärta, betraktar vi detta som en extra fördel. Vi som företag är måna om att hålla jämna takt med omvärlden och vi har som strategi att kontinuerligt fördjupa oss i de fördelar artificiell intelligens för med sig, i syfte att öka produktivitet - för oss och våra kunder.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 Sigma Industry Development erbjuder dig en plattform att forma din framtid. Ett företag där du kan briljera och bidra till det bättre.
   

  

**Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) – ett urval**
 https://starforlife.org/
   

  

 https://expectabettertomorrow.com/
   

  

 https://www.parasport.se/
   

  

 https://rfkhumanrights.org/leadership-council
   

  

**Våra Kärnvärden**
* Familjär identitet - vi värnar om och utmanar varandra i det dagliga arbetet
* Långsiktighet - vi vill växa tillsammans med individen på kort och lång sikt
* Jämställdhet och lika behandling - kom som du är!
* Kreativitet & action - vi är beslutsamma och agerar i sann entreprenörsanda; framåt
* Arbetsglädje - vi gillar att ha kul tillsammans!


**Till detta tillkommer följande förmåner**
* Mobiltelefon och abonnemang
* Liv- och olycksförsäkring
* Friskvårdsbidrag om 5000 SEK/år
* 30 dagar semester


 More information
   

  

 Om du vill vidareutvecklas i rollen som Konsultchef – ta dig mod och skicka in din ansökan till oss idag! Skriv även några rader med dina tankar om tjänsten. Intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte.
   

  

 Om du har frågor är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Oscar för frågor och mer info.
   

  

 Oscar Silversparf, VD, Sigma Industry Development
   

  

 +46 70 209 22 26
   

  

 oscar.silversparf@sigma.se

title: Engineering Manager - AppArmor
description:
As the most widely used Linux distribution, Ubuntu underpins the security of the entire internet. The role of Security Engineering Manager directly impacts the safety and security of millions of users worldwide. Join a team of security experts dedicated to protecting the open-source ecosystem and driving innovation. Your leadership will be instrumental in addressing emerging threats, developing robust security measures, and ensuring the continued integrity of Ubuntu. This is an opportunity to make a tangible difference and leave a lasting legacy on the digital landscape.
   

  

 The AppArmor team's first responsibility is to develop security features and capabilities for AppArmor, the security module protecting all Ubuntu users, by providing mandatory access control to confine programs and restrict their access to system resources.Your work will improve the security of millions of people. You will engage directly with our community and customers, as well as coordinating efforts across multiple engineering teams and projects to make this happen.
   

  

 An Engineering Manager is responsible for line management and career guidance. The ability to develop engineering talent, to represent your team and product from a technical perspective, and to drive collaboration with other teams and customers are all critical to success in this role.
   

  

 What you will do in this role
   

  

* Lead and develop a team of engineers, ranging from graduate to senior
* Coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement disciplined engineering processes
* Represent your team and product to stakeholders, partners, and customers
* Develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices
* Plan and manage progress on agreed goals and projects
* Be an active part of the security engineering leadership team, collaborating with other leaders


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Drive, and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* A love of developing and growing people and a track record of it
* Organised and able to ensure your team delivers timely, high quality results
* Professional manner interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
* Proficient in C and have a good understanding of Linux kernel development
* Experience working with Linux Security Modules
* Knowledgeable and passionate about software and application security
* Solid experience working in an agile development environment
* A demonstrated drive for continual learning
* Builds trust, relationships and confidence
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


 Optional things we value
   

  

* Good understanding of containers/packaging formats


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Konsultuppdrag | Machine Learning Engineer (Senior)
description:
**Profile/Role:** 
 Machine Learning Engineer
 



****Period from:** 
 2024-10-21
   

**Period to:** 
 2025-03-31**
**Utilization:** 
 100%
   

**Remote work allowed:** 
 true
   

**Percentage of remote work allowed:** 
 50%
   

  

  





**Job description:** 




 The primary tasks for a Machine Learning Engineer in MLE area are:
 



 - Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the company
 



 - Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.

 - Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.
 



 - Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company.
 



**Required skills and experiences:**

 - Have 4+ years’ professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.
 



 - A hands-on person who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.
 



 - Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.
 



 - Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+
 



 years.
 



 - Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud.
 



 - Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.
 



 - Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
 



 - Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures,
 



 databases, and data storage technologies.
 



 - Familiar with agile ways of working team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.
 



  

**Required cloud certification:** 
 Azure or GCP
 







  





  





  





**Om oss** 




**Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.
   

 Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.**
