title: Production Engineer
description:
For global production development - initially in coming US facility.
  
We need your experience to launch a new production site in Indianapolis US.
  
A new role/position at ALFDEX in Landskrona, Sweden.
  
Your initial task will be to design, plan and set up the manufacturing line for our electrical drive unit. You will be an important part of our global production development team.
  
About the company
  
Alfdex has a rich history of providing reliable solutions for the purification of crankcase gases in heavy-duty-vehicles. With over 7 million separators sold to industry giants such as VOLVO, Mercedes-Benz, Scania and John Deere, we're already contributing to a greener world.
  
Our 50/50 joint venture between Alfa Laval and Concentric, places us in the forefront of the industry, with headquarters and production in Landskrona (Sweden), and a global presence extending to Kunshan/Shanghai (China), Tumba/Stockholm (Sweden) and Chicago (USA).
  
About the position
  
As production engineer you will be a part of the global production development team (developing our manufacturing systems in Sweden, China, and USA).
  
The position is based in Landskrona, Sweden.
  
The position includes traveling, not the least when it comes to setting up our facility in the US.
  
A lasting employment, starting as soon as possible.
  
Primary work tasks
  
Lead the establishment of the entire production system for electrical motor assembly - from layout and design to equipment selection and installation.
  
Primarily for the production site in Indianapolis – US, and later globally.
  
Develop and implement manufacturing processes focusing on efficiency and quality.
  
Source and qualify equipment suppliers, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.
  
Develop comprehensive training programs for production staff, ensuring a smooth knowledge transfer during production system launch.
  
Create and maintain detailed documentation of processes and procedures.
  
Your background - must have
  
Engineer or having the work experience to fully weigh up for it, preferably in
  
mechatronics or mechanical engineering.
  
Strong project management and problem-solving skills.
  
Proficiency in CAD software.
  
Swedish and English preferably, but English is a must.
  
Proven experience in setting up and launching production systems, preferably in
  
electrical motor assembly or a related industry.
  
Strong understanding of manufacturing processes.
  
Experience of quality control methodologies and tools.
  
Your background - good to have
  
Experience from the automotive industry.
  
Experience in mechatronics.
  
Your personality and qualities
  
To succeed in this role and to thrive at Alfdex, we believe you need to be:
  
**Adaptable:** the ability to adapt to changing circumstances and unforeseen challenges are crucial as is an adaptable mindset.
  
**Problem-solver:** identifying issues, analysing root causes, and implementing effective solutions. To be able to think critically and creatively.
  
**Resilient:** start-ups can be demanding, and setbacks are not uncommon.
  
Resilience is crucial for bouncing back from challenges and maintaining a positive and determined mindset.
  
We also think that you are driven, eager to develop, aiming to create secure and safe processes, flexible and resourceful.
  
Do you have what it takes and would like to be a part of our ongoing journey? Don't hesitate to apply for the position, but please do it straight away. We're looking for a speedy recruitment process and are really looking forward to welcoming you into the Alfdex family.

title: MV Electrification and Application Engineer
description:
Eaton has been a key player in the Middle East for 40 years. This July, we announced the construction of a **new sustainable campus in Dubai**, which will bring together our commercial, manufacturing, and support functions, providing room for future growth.

 **About Eaton**


Eaton is a power management company where we provide energy-efficient solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power more efficiently, safely and sustainably. Eaton is dedicated to improving the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technology and services. Eaton has approximately 96,000 employees and sells products to customers in more than 175 countries.

  

We are seeking an experienced **MV Electrification and Application Engineer** to join our team in **Dubai.**

**What you’ll do:**
-------------------



The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of MV Systems design principles, and applicable codes. Aware of Eaton’s Medium Voltage Switchgear and Grid Automation solution. Responsibilities include designing, analyzing, and implementing Utilities applications. The perfect candidate should be currently working in MV switchgear manufacturer/OEM within UAE.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Design and specify electrical systems/solution for Utilities application including equipment design/selection and Software implementation.
* Professional in using EPLAN/similar software along with the advanced automation features like macros.
* Preparing detailed electrical drawings submittals including General arrangement drawings, schematics, and bill of materials.
* Expert in power systems studies including load flow analysis, short circuit studies, Arc Flash analysis, relay coordination using simulation software packages like ETAP.
* Initiate and lead Engineering development & optimization activities including process/activities automation.
* Able to engage with Consultants/PMCs and end-users for technical approvals.
* Coordination between different internal and external teams.
* Problem solving techniques including troubleshooting of electrical system site issues and provide technical support to End Users /PMC & Consultants.
* Stay up-to-date on latest electrical codes and standards
* Early engagement with End Users/EPCs & Consultants on project development and spec-in activities when required.
* Close discussion with the Factories/BUs to ensure customers/projects requirements compliance.
* Continuous collaboration with the Product Line Managers respectively to understand the product updates and tactics.
* Engaging with the CSO's to understand more about the market dynamics and voice of customers.
**Qualifications:**
-------------------


* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from a reputed institute
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in electrical system design for industrial applications
**Skills:**
-----------


* In-depth knowledge of IEC, IEEE, NEC other applicable electrical codes and standards
* Proficient in electrical design software, 3D Modeling software is a plus.
* Software Requirements:
	+ EPLAN/ELCAD – Advanced Level
	+ AutoCAD – Advanced Level
	+ ETAP – Advanced Level
	+ Microsoft Excel and Macros – Advanced Level
	+ SAP – Intermediate Level
	+ Python, C++, other Language is a Plus
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
* Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team


#LI-SA2

**What we offer:**
------------------


* Being part of a company that has been in business for more than 100 years, is well known in the industry, and has a major impact on the energy industry
* Work in a company that is commitment to Inclusion & Diversity and Sustainability
* Annual mentoring program, Eaton University, a reward, and recognition system
* Ongoing Learning and Career Development Opportunities in a global company. Build your career and apply internally for our open positions worldwide
* Strong, agile and diverse team locally and globally
* Strong processes and state-of-the-art systems and tools
* Structured employee development processes, open feedback culture with development plans
* Detailed induction support and well-structured onboarding
* Balance your work and life with a hybrid worktime model
 **Living and Working in Dubai:**

  

Dubai is a vibrant, cosmopolitan city known for its modern architecture, luxurious lifestyle, and rich cultural heritage. Living and working in Dubai offers an exceptional quality of life with world-class amenities, a safe environment, and a thriving expatriate community. Experience a dynamic blend of work and leisure in one of the world’s most exciting cities.

  

Ready to make a difference? Join Eaton’s Dubai Team and be part of a company shaping the future of sustainable manufacturing and power management!

  

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for job applicants and employees. Our recruitment processes use balanced selection criteria and avoid unlawful discrimination against applicants on the basis of their age, colour, disability, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity, genetic information, race or racial origin, religion, sexual orientation or any other status protected or required by law.
company_description: Eaton is dedicated to improving the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services.

title: Konsultchef inom Mjukvaru- och Systemutveckling
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Söker du en arbetsplats där du dagligen får utmanas och utvecklas inom entreprenörskap, ledarskap och ingenjörskap? Då är Sigma Industry Development rätt företag för dig.



Sigma Industry Development är ett dotterbolag inom SIEN-koncernen som fortsätter sin framgångsrika tillväxtresa utan att tumma på kvalitet. Två år i följd har pris vunnits som ett av Sveriges bäst välskötta företag, samt topp10-ranking i medarbetartrivsel på nationell nivå. Med andra ord är manegen krattad för fortsatta framgångar och arbetsglädje.



Nu söker vi en konsultchef till sektionen Mekatronik. Sektionen utgörs idag av 13 ingenjörer inom AI, mjukvaru- och hårdvaruutveckling, test och verifiering. Du kommer ha fördelen att ansluta dig till en etablerad kundbas, men ha fria tyglar att sätta din prägel på verksamheten och dess framtida strategi, samtidigt som teamet vill utvecklas genom ditt ledarskap och målsättningar.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Din uppgift är att hjälpa teamet och verksamheten att utvecklas ytterligare, genom att navigera mot hög tillväxt och säkerställa nya affärer. Din roll är mångfacetterad där du kommer arbetar med att anställa de bästa talangerna och utveckla dessa, samtidigt som du brinner för affärsutveckling där målet är att etablera nya kundsamarbeten och driver in de stora affärerna. Detta utan att varken köra slut på ditt bränsle eller skada den goda (arbets-) miljön.



Vi ser att du har erfarenhet från försäljning och ledarskap i konsultbranschen, samt ett brett nätverk i Stockholmsregionen och du är en person som inte bara snackar utan gillar att få saker att hända.



**Utbildning**



* MSc i Datavetenskap, Mekatronik, Teknisk fysik, eller liknande utbildningsbakgrund **eller** har förvärvat motsvarande kunskap genom flera års erfarenhet inom området.


**Erfarenhet inom**


* Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av ledarskap och försäljning inom konsultbranschen, särskilt inom mjukvaru- och systemutveckling.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och leda team samt utveckla långsiktiga kundrelationer.


**Språkkunskap**



* Svenska och engelska, flytande i tal och skrift (båda är krav för anställning)

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Om AI har en speciell plats i ditt ingenjörshjärta, betraktar vi detta som en extra fördel. Vi som företag är måna om att hålla jämna takt med omvärlden och vi har som strategi att kontinuerligt fördjupa oss i de fördelar artificiell intelligens för med sig, i syfte att öka produktivitet - för oss och våra kunder.


### **WE OFFER**



Sigma Industry Development erbjuder dig en plattform att forma din framtid. Ett företag där du kan briljera och bidra till det bättre.



**Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) – ett urval**



https://starforlife.org/



https://expectabettertomorrow.com/



https://www.parasport.se/



https://rfkhumanrights.org/leadership-council



**Våra Kärnvärden**



* Familjär identitet - vi värnar om och utmanar varandra i det dagliga arbetet
* Långsiktighet - vi vill växa tillsammans med individen på kort och lång sikt
* Jämställdhet och lika behandling - kom som du är!
* Kreativitet & action - vi är beslutsamma och agerar i sann entreprenörsanda; framåt
* Arbetsglädje - vi gillar att ha kul tillsammans!


**Till detta tillkommer följande förmåner**



* Mobiltelefon och abonnemang
* Liv- och olycksförsäkring
* Friskvårdsbidrag om 5000 SEK/år
* 30 dagar semester

### **MORE INFORMATION**



Om du vill vidareutvecklas i rollen som Konsultchef – ta dig mod och skicka in din ansökan till oss idag! Skriv även några rader med dina tankar om tjänsten. Intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte.



Om du har frågor är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Oscar för frågor och mer info.



Oscar Silversparf, VD, Sigma Industry Development



+46 70 209 22 26



oscar.silversparf@sigma.se

Konsultchef inom Mjukvaru- och Systemutveckling
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Development

Stockholm, Sweden

Mechanical Engineering, Hardware Electronics, Testing and Verification, Project Management, Software development embedded systems, Function development, System design, Project Management, Software development

2024-10-07

2024-10-31

Oscar Silversparf, oscar.silversparf@sigma.se, +46702092226

title: Network Security Consultant (Check Point)
description:
**About Integrity360**



Integrity360 is one of Europe’s leading cyber security specialists operating from office locations spread out across Europe, providing a comprehensive range of professional, support and managed cyber security services for our 300+ clients. With four top-class Security Operation Centers, we offer a complete end-to-end security services covering our clients’ security from every angle. Our services include Managed Security, Cyber Security Testing, Incident Response, Security Integration, PCI Compliance and Cyber Risk & Assurance services.

  

What sets Integrity360 apart is our excellent team of people that drive the business forward. The company was founded with a focus on technical expertise and that philosophy remains today. The skills and experience in our company are some of the greatest in the industry and clients remain with Integrity360 because they can rely on and trust us to go above and beyond to ensure their needs are met. Listed multiple times on Gartner Market Guides for Managed Security Services.

 **Job Role**



A Network Security Consultant is a specialized professional responsible for ensuring the security and integrity of an organization's computer networks and information systems. They work to protect against various cyber threats, including malware, hackers, and data breaches, by implementing robust security measures and best practices.


**Checkpoint expert** with strong knowledge of network infrastructure security on firewalls ,routers, switches and the associated network protocols and concepts is required.



Minimum of 5 year’s proven experience as a Network Security Engineer/Consultant with primary experience in Checkpoint with complementary experience with Fortinet and F5

 **Primary Duties/Responsibilities include:**


* **Security Assessment and Analysis:**
	+ Evaluate existing network infrastructure for vulnerabilities and weaknesses.
	+ Conduct risk assessments to identify potential security threats and their impact.
	+ Understand firewall/load balancing/web proxy deployments, troubleshooting intrinsically.
	+ Analyse security logs and incidents to detect and respond to security breaches.
* **Security Strategy and Planning:**
	+ Develop and implement comprehensive network security strategies and policies.
	+ Recommend security solutions and technologies to address identified vulnerabilities or gaps.
	+ Create disaster recovery and incident response plans.
* **Firewall and Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS):**
	+ Configure, manage, and monitor firewall and IDS/IPS systems.
	+ Fine-tune rule sets to enhance network security and minimize false positives.
* **Security Infrastructure Deployment:**
	+ Install, configure, and maintain security appliances and software. Including firewalls, VPN Terminators,
	+ Load Balancers and Web Proxies.
* **Network Access Control:**
	+ Establish access control policies and mechanisms to control network access.
	+ Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.
* **Incident Response and Remediation:**
	+ Be available for escalation of security incidents. Contribute to root causes analysis, and recommend corrective actions.
	+ Coordinate with other IT teams to mitigate security breaches and recover compromised systems.
* **Documentation and Reporting:**
	+ Maintain accurate records of security configurations, incidents, and resolutions.
	+ Generate regular security reports for management and stakeholders.
	+ Present project and security reporting to internal and client management
  


**Required Skills**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field (Master's preferred).
* **Vendor certification/hands on experience with CheckPoint, Fortinet, F5, Zscaler, Ivanti Pulse Secure**
* Professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CompTIA Security+, are considered a plus
* Proven experience in network security, with a deep understanding of network protocols and architectures.
* Strong knowledge of security tools and technologies, including firewalls, IDS/IPS, VPNs, and SIEM.
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements and standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, NIST, ISO 27001).
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* A Network Security Consultant is crucial in maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of an organization's data and systems. They
* Play a pivotal role in proactively identifying and mitigating security risks to ensure business continuity and protect sensitive information.

  


**Integrity360 Employee Benefits (UK)**

  



At Integrity360 we aim to reflect what’s important through the benefits we offer. We survey our people regularly and encourage discussions around these tops so we can understand what really makes a difference. Our benefits priorities are physical, mental and financial wellbeing.

  


**Mental & Physical wellbeing:**


* AXA health insurance
* Dental Cover
* Optical Cover
* Virtual GP, no need to see your GP first, our cover ensures fast access to appropriate care 24/7, this includes:
* Mental Health
* Physical Health

  


**Financial wellbeing benefits:**



We guarantee that every employee will have their pay reviewed at least once every year, if not more regularly. We aim to pay within the market range for all roles and keep pace with inflation on average.



What we offer:


* Twice yearly salary reviews
* 4% Contributory Pension
* Income Protection
* Death-in-Service cover, covering 2 times your basic salary.

  


**Other benefits include:**


* 25 days’ annual leave, 1 extra day gained per year of service up to 28 days. Options to carry over 5 days.
* Our L&D program, we work with various platforms including Cybrary, Udemy, Preply, Pluralsight, Swift and HTB ensuring our people are up to date with their industry knowledge. Offering opportunities to further upskill and gain industry leading certifications.


**\*Strictly no agencies\***
company_addresses: Integrity360, The Concourse, Block D, Beacon Court, Sandyford, Co. Dublin, Ireland
company_description: Integrity360 is one of Europe's leading cyber security services and solutions provider.

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
**Your role as software test engineer**


Your focus will be software testing and analysis for one of our development teams. You will collaborate with the other roles in the team; developers in C/C++/Simulink and system designers.

  

One part of the work is to define a test plan and thereafter develop the tests cases accordingly. Testing will be done in HIL, boxcar & complete vehicle testing. We test our own developed SW but also run tests on system level.

  

Our product is a service developed as an app in the core computing platform. We work with test and verification of several projects and releases which require you to keep track of what to test, when in time and in what test environment. It’s necessary to be able to shift between different tasks such as verification, test development and fault tracing.

  

You will be involved in analysis of fault reports to find the root cause and suggest solutions to the problem. For this position it’s necessary to have experience in vehicle testing and good analysis skills.

  

The tests will be documented in CarWeaver.

  


Skills needed:


* A&V experience
* Communications protocols as CAN, LIN, Ethernet
* Vector tools as Canoe & Canalyzer.
* Robot Framework
* Zuul
* XCP, DLT logging

  




Beneficial skills


* C++
* C
* Simulink

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
We are seeking a talented and innovative Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and drive the development of advanced computer vision solutions. As part of a dynamic and multidisciplinary team, you will play a key role in creating and optimizing algorithms that process visual data, enhance real-time performance, and integrate seamlessly into embedded systems.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Design, implement, and refine machine learning algorithms to address complex computer vision challenges.
* Prepare, clean, and manage large datasets to ensure they meet the standards for effective model training and evaluation.
* Develop and fine-tune deep learning models to achieve high performance on diverse visual tasks.
* Optimize models for real-time execution on resource-constrained embedded systems, balancing memory and computational requirements.
* Collaborate on requirement gathering, testing, and documentation to ensure successful deployment of machine learning solutions.

 **Qualifications:**

* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a closely related discipline.
* Strong programming skills in Python, C, and C++.
* Solid understanding of deep learning techniques and architectures.
* Experience working with sensor data and various types of image/video inputs.
* Ability to collaborate effectively within a cross-functional team environment.

 ***Other:***

*The assignment may be covered by defense secrecy, which means requirements for a certain citizenship and approval of a security clearance.*

 **Who are we?**

Conmore is a consulting company that highly prioritizes its employees. We provide exciting and challenging assignments and do our utmost in every situation in order to meet your desire for a matching position. To enhance and strengthen you as an individual all employees have their own development plan for individual growth. In order for everyone to develop further and thrive in their role as consultants, the group manager dedicates time for regular one-on-one meetings to listen and follow up on the work plan, and need for training, provide feedback, and more to make sure you are satisfied and in the right place.


We are proud of our company’s unique community feeling and we highly value competence and a secure work environment which we believe contributes to a pleasant and motivating workplace. Besides professional activities such as training et cetera, we offer regular social activities which bring us together to have a good time and share knowledge and experiences in the group. Despite our constant willingness to grow as a company we still emphasize preserving our warm community feeling.  



  

**Would you also like to be a part of our team?**  

  

We are recruiting continuously, please don’t hesitate with your application and feel free to contact us if you have questions.


We encourage all engineers to apply regardless gender, background or life situation.

**Responsible Talent Acquisition Specialist**: Daniella Hernandez


Mail: daniella.hernandez@conmore.se


Phone: +46 70-624 0344

**Please note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail.** Please use our career site.


We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Packaging Solution Engineer - IKEA Food, RA Consumer Packaged Goods
description:
**Job ID:** R0009409


**Date posted:** 08/10/2024


Do you have a passion for creating a better life at home for many people and therefore an extensive interest in contributing to food solutions? Leading packaging development is intricately linked to business development in Range Area (RA) food Consumer-Packaged Goods.


Then this opportunity might be for you. As a Packaging Solution Engineer, you are an important contributor in the product development process, ideation and creation of new products and solutions aiming for best customer experience and satisfaction. We believe “packaging is part of the product” BUT at RA Consumer Packaged Goods, we believe, Packaging is the product!

**Job Description**  

IKEA of Sweden is a global product development and innovation hub, where you will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of product types as well as test and work with cutting edge materials/technologies and face many technical challenges every day.


As a Packaging Solution Engineer, you are responsible for:

* Lead the packaging development for your development team and hence portfolio thereof, this is where you lead the business from packaging perspective.
* Design and develop innovative packaging solutions for a range of Consumer-Packaged Goods, considering factors such as product dimensions, sale solution, logistic set up, supplier capabilities, shipping requirements, finally customers’ expectations.
* Collaborate with product designers, engineers, and suppliers to integrate packaging considerations into the product development process.
* Conduct verification testing and analysis to evaluate the performance of packaging designs.
* Optimize packaging by maximizing usage of IKEA Packaging Standards and Shared Solutions, materials, and processes to reduce costs, minimize waste, and enhance sustainability.
* Stay informed about industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to packaging design, materials, and sustainability initiatives.
* Work closely with logistics and supply chain teams to optimize packaging configurations for transportation and storage efficiency.
* Support continuous improvement efforts to enhance the quality and functionality of packaging solutions.
* Responsible for creation and validity of technical packaging documentation through the entire lifecycle of product.

**Qualifications**  

To be successful in this job we believe you have:

* Bachelor's degree in Packaging Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
* Previous experience in packaging design and development in the food industry is an advantage but not a must.
* Proficiency in CAD software-SolidWorks, Artios etc. for designing packaging structures and prototypes.
* Knowledge of packaging materials, manufacturing processes, and regulatory requirements.
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment.
* Passion for sustainability and a commitment to reducing environmental impact through packaging innovation.
* A self-driven, structured, resourceful person who takes initiative and leads your work forward.
* You are solutions oriented, able to prioritize, with a drive in making tough decisions. You like to be challenged and to keep learning new things. You will work with colleagues from all over the world. You therefore need to be fluent in English.

**Additional information**  

Our Food business is a strong contributor to the IKEA brand and business growth, and we have the ambition to drive positive change in the food industry.


We are on an existing journey where we, over the next years, will continue to strengthen the core of what we do developing food that is good for people and the planet. Every day we dare to challenge ourselves and live our values and we embrace the future and face the opportunities to enable success.


We are in Älmhult, in IKEA of Sweden, where the total customer offer is being developed where we want to work close to our IKEA colleagues across the value chain and how we meet our customers every day. For example, did you know that more than 520 million guests enjoyed our food last year?  

Apply


Please send us your application, CV, in English latest 22 October 2024. We really want to get to know you, so instead of a motivational letter please let us know:

* Why you find this job interesting
* Why you think you will have a good fit for the job


This is a permanent onsite position located at Älmhult, Sweden.


If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Recruiter Jonas Levin at Jonas.levin@inter.ikea.com and if you need more information about the role please contact Hiring Manager Puneet Trehan at puneet.trehan@inter.ikea.com
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: AI Engineer, Sweden - BCG X
description:
Who We Are


Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.  

  

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

 **We Are BCG X**

  

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

  

What You'll Do


Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

  


Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We are looking for dedicated individuals with a passion for software development, large-scale data analytics and redefining organizations into AI led innovative companies. Successful candidates possess the following:
* Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
* Actively involved in every part of the software development process
* Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
* Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
* Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
* Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
* A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics
  

What You'll Bring

**TECHNOLOGIES:**

  

Programming Languages: Python

  

#LI-DNI

  

#BCGXjob

  

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
  

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Recent Graduated Engineers - Your future challenge starts here!
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Saab is growing across the country and is constantly looking for new talent! If you are at the end of your studies or at the beginning of your career and want to continue developing while working to keep people and society safe, you are warmly welcome to apply to us.
   

  

*Ready to find your path? Try new things. Share experiences. And discover what you truly enjoy.*
**Your** 
**role**
 With us, learning is everywhere. A place where each day is a chance to discover something new, share what you know and learn from others. Here, you´ll get inspired by a bunch of smart and experienced people. Ready to dive in? You can explore different areas, find a new passion, and figure out your own path. Plus, we got plenty of courses and training to help you level up your skills. Grow with us, every step of the way.
   

  

 Saab offers diverse roles and continuous learning opportunities within IT, software development, systems engineering, electronics and mechanical engineering, just to mention a few. Start your journey as an engineer with us and play a key role in developing cutting-edge defense and security systems.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To be a successful employee at Saab, you need to be a curious person who thrives in a supportive and friendly workplace where teamwork is the core to find smart solutions. You should be in the final stages of your post-secondary studies or a recent graduate.
   

  

 We believe that you have a Bachelor´s or Master´s degree within one of the following fields:
   

  

* Information Technology/System Science
* Computer Science
* Engineering Physics
* Electrical Engineering
* Mechatronics
* Mechanical Engineering


 Whether you’re passionate about creating secure and robust systems, developing innovative electrical or mechanical solutions, or engage in complex problem solving, we offer varied roles to match your skills and interest.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

**What You Will Be Part Of**
 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Does this sound like something you want to hear more about? Submit your application today! Selection and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Hi,
 



  





 Kollin helps engineering students with their studies. Our platform transforms static academic content into engaging, interactive experiences. Our mission is to boost student success and retention in STEM fields by giving students what they need: tools from 2024. Founded by passionate engineers, Kollin has already captured a significant market share among Swedish universities. We're now poised for rapid growth and innovation as we have gotten grants by Vinnova to build an adaptive learning system with the help of AI.
 



  





 We're seeking a Full Stack Engineer with a few years experience to help us strengthen our tech team, build features and make sure our app stays ahead of its competitors.
 



  





**Some of the things we will work on:** 




 • Automated content processing pipelines
 



 • LLM integration for personalized learning
 



 • Interactive learning tools and rich editors
 



 • User dashboards and adaptive study plans
 



 • Community features and AI-assisted tools
 



  





**Our tech stack includes:** 




 • Frontend: Next.js, React
 



 • Backend: Node.js, GraphQL
 



 • Database: Neon, RDS
 



 • Infrastructure: AWS, Microservices, Vercel
 



  





**Skills and experience:** 




 • 3+ years of professional web development experience
 



 • Strong skills in JavaScript/TypeScript and React
 



 • Experience with Node.js and GraphQL APIs
 



 • Familiarity with AWS services and microservices architecture
 



 • Passion for education and AI technologies
 



  





 We hope that you are as passionate as we are to building great tools for learning. There is so much happening in this space right now and we want to work with other tech enthusiasts who can see all there is to do in the AI for learning space.
 



  





 Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Engineer - Solutions Engineering
description:
Help us shape the future of open source IT, devops, and IS, from bare metal to containers. Our goal is to revolutionise open source application and infrastructure operations.
   

  

 We want to transform the world of software operations by enabling true model-driven operations via next-generation infrastructure-as-code. This will allow companies to run very efficient bare-metal operations for high-performance computing, private cloud, data lakes, AI/ML, and analytics. We need to invent some new technology, and we need to build some new products; we are therefore looking for someone who can lead and inspire a regional software engineering team to fulfill this initiative.
   

  

 The Solutions Engineering team works in close collaboration with our managed infrastructure operations team, which runs many private OpenStack clouds and Kubernetes clusters for customers around the world. This enables us to improve our infra-as-code products based on our own real experience, mirroring that of our users and customers. We work in Python, creating open source automation capabilities that simplify operations for anybody, anywhere, who is building on Ubuntu.
   

  

 Most of the team's work involves pure Python software development focused on enabling true DevOps workflows. We strive for high quality in both design, documentation, tests, and performance as we enhance operations code packages and Ubuntu itself in order to ensure our platform is the easiest, most robust, and best performing for driving your infrastructure.
   

  

 This role is ideal for software engineers who want to work in a global team, have a passion for distributed systems and cloud computing, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Work in Python and Golang to design and deliver open source software operations code
* Work with the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
* Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
* Rethink open source operations for our customers and open source community
* Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
* Follow agile software development practices
* Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
* Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
* Global travel up to 10% of time for internal and external events


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a passionate Python developer
* You are organised and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software
* You understand the importance of reliable operations in an agile world
* You have sound knowledge of cloud computing concepts & technologies
* You have practical knowledge of Linux and networking
* You are a lifelong learner


 Bonus points for
   

  

* You have graduated with a university degree in Computer Science or related software engineering field
* Golang programming skills


 What you will learn
   

  

* OpenStack and Kubernetes in production
* Thinking rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
* Wide range of open source applications and skills
* Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools


 We offer:
   

  

* 100% work-from-home
* Learning and development
* Competitive salary
* Recognition rewards
* Annual leave
* Priority Pass for travel


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
   

  

 #Stack

title: Automotive/Embedded Software Engineer
description:
Want to take your coding skills to the next level in embedded systems development within Automotive? Look no further! Knowit Connectivity is an enthusiastic and rapidly expanding IT consultancy firm that thrives on innovation and technology. As we continue to grow, we're on the hunt for skilled and ambitious individuals to join our team and help us achieve even greater success.
   

  

**Your role as an Automotive Engineer**
 We are looking for you who enjoys being part of a team and take responsibility for your contribution to the team. Flexibility and curiosity are words that fit you together with an innovative and open mind to other ideas and input. Our ideal candidates is more than an experts - they're an exceptional communicators, a proactive problem-solvers, and a dedicated learner who passionately imparts knowledge to their peers. We do also value your curiosity and interest in the technical prospect, as our world and the industry environments constantly are changing. Our customers are within the Stockholm region and today we have a hybrid way of working with a mix of onsite, in-house and remote work depending on the projects.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we expect you to have experience in:**
* Either C++/C programming or model based development using Simulink
* End-to-end development (Design, implementation, documentation, testing, verification, validation…)
* Linux
* Knowledge of ISO26262, ISO 21434, and/or A-SPICE


**It is meriting if you also have experience in one or more of the following:**
* Working with automotive communication (e.g. CAN, Automotive Ethernet, etc.)
* Working with real-time systems
* Scripting in Python
* Testing on unit, integration and/or system level
* Testing using HIL, PIL and/or SIL.


**Other things that would be interesting if you had experience in are**
* Requirements management
* Working with Autosar; classic or adaptive
* Experience in working with verification and validation
* Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc)


 This job requires that you can express yourself well in English, both verbally and in writing.
   

  

**About Us**
 Knowit offers an exciting workplace that provides great opportunities for our employees to develop, both professionally and personally. With supportive, versatile, and creative colleagues, we at Knowit Connectivity Stockholm offer an exciting and inclusive culture where we strive to ensure a healthy balance between private life and professional life. In addition to complementing each other professionally, we also make sure we have fun together, both inside and outside of office hours, with a variety of events such as workshops, informative seminars and casual after-works.
   

  

 All our leaders have a great focus on our employees and through a close dialogue with you, we promise to do our utmost to make the next project the best of your life so far. We are a company that values a culture of closeness and community. We listen when you have suggestions for improvements or new ideas for events and will always encourage you to try new solutions. Knowit is a fast-paced, fun, and inspiring workplace with a great team spirit. With us, you work to make a difference and to develop both Knowit’ s business and our customers.
   

  

**Application**
 Apply now trough the link or contact responsible recruiter Rasmus Lundin rasmus.lundin@knowit.se or hiring manager Joakim Oscarsson, joakim.oscarsson@knowit.se for more information or questions.

title: Senior Java developer
description:
**Är du en erfaren Javautvecklare som söker nya utmaningar?** 
 Hos B3 Innovation får du möjligheten att arbeta i en miljö där innovation och samarbete står i fokus. Vi söker dig med djup kunskap inom Java och som trivs i en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Din Roll
   

  

 Som Senior Java Developer hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* Utveckla högkvalitativa och skalbara lösningar.
* Samarbeta med ett tvärfunktionellt team av experter.
* Delta i design och arkitektur av nya system.


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi letar efter en person som:
   

  

* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av Javautveckling.
* Våra kunder jobbar bl.a. med Kafka, Kotlin, Spring, Microservices och oftast i en CI/CD-miljö. Har du dessutom kunskaper inom Techlead blir vi extra glada!
* Är bekväm med moderna utvecklingsmetoder som Agile och DevOps.
* Har ett öga för detaljer och brinner för att leverera kvalitativa lösningar.


 Varför Innovation?
   

  

* Innovativ Kultur: Vi uppmuntrar kreativitet och nya idéer.
* Inkluderande Miljö: Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter en arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna.
* Balans och Flexibilitet: Vi förstår vikten av balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder flexibla arbetstider.
* Gemenskap: Hos oss blir du en del av ett stöttande team som arbetar tillsammans för att nå gemensamma mål.


 Om B3 Innovation
   

  

 B3 Innovation är en del av B3 Consulting Group, en av Sveriges ledande IT-konsultbolag. Vi är kända för vårt fokus på innovation och förmåga att leverera värde till våra kunder. Genom att kombinera djup teknisk expertis med en stark förståelse för våra kunders verksamhet, skapar vi lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Vår kultur bygger på öppenhet, samarbete och en passion för teknik.
   

  

 Vi är verksamma inom många olika branscher t ex media, bank och finans, offentlig sektor, telekom eller e-handel och jobbar tillsammans med att hitta det uppdrag som passar dig bäst! Med andra ord så kan du som Javautvecklare få arbeta med ex att optimera TV-sändningar, utveckla e-handel, hjälpa transporter eller möta utmaningarna inom smarta hem.
   

  

 Ansök Nu!
   

  

 Är du redo att ta nästa steg? Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade och innovativa team!
   

  

 Om du är mer nyfiken på oss så kan du läsa mer om oss här: https://www.b3.se/innovation
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!
   

  

 Om du har funderingar så hör gärna av dig till Kenneth Andersson på +46706678050 alt mail kenneth.andersson@b3.se Hoppas vi hörs!

title: Billing System Software Engineer
description:
**The role of a Billing System Engineer, Commercial Systems at Canonical**
 This engineering role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success of those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development, you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 The Commercial Systems unit has several areas of responsibility spread across six engineering teams, closely collaborating with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems unit are at the heart of Canonical business and Salesforce plays an integral role in it.
   

  

 The Billing team's mission is to develop an internal billing system delivering a consistent billing experience to all Canonical customers across all products and services, and across all service delivery methods. This challenging assignment requires close cooperation with business departments to ensure our customers are billed accurately and reliably, while achieving the highest engineering standards expected of any engineering team at Canonical.
   

  

 We are looking for new colleagues at all seniority levels, who strive for the highest engineering quality, seek improvements, continuously develop their skills, and apply them at work. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a fairly unique solution and gain expertise in billing and finance.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

**What your day will look like**
* Deliver engineering solutions in Go or Python
* Collaborate with colleagues on technical designs and code reviews
* Deploy and operate services developed by the team
* Seek Improvements to engineering and operations practices


**What we are looking for in you**
* Experience as a software developer in a high-level language - preferably Go or Python
* Experience building, deploying, and operating distributed systems and APIs
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Ability to collaborate remotely with a diverse set of team members and stakeholders, remain highly motivated, productive, and organized in a fully remote environment
* Ability to travel to international destinations for one week at a time, approximately 2-4 times per year. Locations prior to the global pandemic included New York, Seattle, London, Cape Town, Budapest, Berlin, Montreal, and Brussels


**Additional skills that you might also bring**
* Experience with Salesforce, NetSuite, or Stripe APIs
* Experience in a business role such as sales, finance, or operations
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related engineering field


**What we offer you**
 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

description:
Vi söker erfaren .NET utvecklare för att stärka vår växande utvecklingsenhet! Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med spännande projekt tillsammans med våra kunder, som kan innebära att forma framtidens hälso- och sjukvårdstjänster eller att påverka framtidens energitjänster. Vi tror på meningsfulla och varierande projekt som motiverar och utvecklar våra medarbetare. Du kan arbeta i Stockholm eller Göteborg där vi har fasta kontor eller flexibelt var som helst i Sverige.
   

  

 Solita är känt som ett gediget kompetensföretag och vi kan garantera att du lär dig mer när du börjar hos oss – det är vårt löfte till dig. Genom att värna om kontinuerligt lärande ser vi till att vi har intressanta projekt för framtiden, och även möjligheter till projektrotationer.
   

  

 Så här säger Antti Kinnunen som är övergripande ansvarig för den svenska utvecklingsenheten:
   

  

*”Vi vill vara den bästa arbetsgivaren för mjukvaruutvecklare i Sverige. Solita investerar mycket i Solitans välbefinnande och kontinuerliga lärande. Vi är ett teknik agnostiskt mjukvaruutvecklingsföretag som erbjuder ett brett utbud av färdigheter relaterade till teknologier som .NET, Java, Clojure och React samt GCP, AWS, Azure, OutSystems m.m”*
**Som .NET Utvecklare Hos Oss Kommer Du**
* Arbeta med de senaste teknologierna och utveckla innovativa lösningar för våra kunder.
* Jobba med utmanande projekt inom en rad branscher där du får möjlighet att använda kunskap du har samlat på dig samt växa i din roll.
* Ha möjlighet att vara med i uppbyggnaden av vår dev-enhet i Sverige.
* Samarbeta med kollegor i en miljö som präglas av hög grad av eget ansvar och tillit.
* Ständigt utvecklas och lära dig nya saker


**Varför jobba på Solita?**
 Vår företagskultur är väldigt, väldigt viktig för oss, vi har en platt organisation med fokus på engagemang, ansvarstagande och värdeskapande arbete. Som anställd hos oss kan du vänta dig;
   

  

* Ett företag som är intresserad av sammanhållning, välbefinnande och utveckling. Du kan läsa mer om det här; Solita Culture – Part 1: Come as you are – Solita
* Growth Academy – vår plattform för kunskapsutveckling som stöttar din fortsatta utveckling. Vi tror på kontinuerligt lärande och uppmuntrar våra medarbetare att utveckla sin kompetens inom flera olika områden genom nätverkande, info sessions, certifieringar och mer.
* Bra förmåner – som in-house coach för att stötta dig, fredagsfrukost, hobbyklubbar, pension under din föräldraledighet och mycket mer!


**Vad vi söker**
 Vi Tror På Att Samarbete Är Viktigt För Att Hitta Lösningar På Komplexa Problem. Därför Söker Vi Dig Som Gillar Att Arbeta Tillsammans Med Andra För Att Uppnå Gemensamma Mål. Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har Tidigare Erfarenhet Av Att Arbeta i En Konsultativ Roll, Eller Om Du Har Ett Intresse För Att Arbeta Inom Detta Område. Vi Ser Även Att Du Har
   

  

* Goda kunskaper i .NET och C#
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med databaser (t ex SQL-databaser)
* Du är flytande i eller intresserad av att använda molnteknik i dina projekt. Till exempel kan Azure, AWS eller GCP vara bekanta för dig.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila projekt och med continuous integration.


**Om oss**
 Vi är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med fler än 1700 personer i sex länder (varav 200 i Sverige). Med vår storlek är vi tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil arbetsgivare som vågar ta ut svängarna och samtidigt tillräckligt små för att kunna bry oss om varandra och våra kunder. Vi har bred kompetens inom systemutveckling, moln, integrationer och service design där rotation mellan uppdrag och teknikområden inte bara är möjlig, men även uppmuntras. Vårt bemanningsteam arbetar för att matcha våra medarbetares önskemål med tillgängliga kundprojekt. Du kommer att få en fullskalig och genomarbetad onboarding och du kommer att ha en teamledare som är intresserad av dig under din tid på Solita.
   

  

 Nu satsar vi lite extra på att bygga en spännande svensk enhet för systemutveckling för att kunna bygga högkvalitativa applikationer och lösningar för stora företag och myndigheter även i Sverige.
   

  

 Undrar du över vad det skulle innebära att vara utvecklare hos oss? Läs om vad Emma har att berätta om det!
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Berätta om dig själv och dina önskemål så kan vi tillsammans ta reda på om vi passar ihop. Om du har några frågor, chatta gärna med Fredrik på LinkedIn eller skicka ett mail till honom fredrik.hultmar(at)solita.se. Du kan också kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Sebastian på LinkedIn eller mail sebastian.laine@solita.se.
   

  

 Vår rekryteringsresa består av två intervjuer. Vid den första fokuserar vi på att lära känna dig och på att presentera Solita för dig. Vid nästa tillfälle fokuserar vi på att utvärdera ditt nuvarande tekniska kunnande tillsammans med några av dina potentiella framtida kollegor. Vi strävar efter att ge dig en sanningsenlig bild av hur det är att arbeta på Solita inför ditt stora beslut.
   

  

 Vi rekryterar även i Göteborg, Malmö och Skellefteå!

title: Backend Developer - Data Driven Services
description:
The industry is going through big changes - the transformation to the smart and connected factory. Join our multinational team and develop innovative solutions for sustainable and flexible industrial production to customers worldwide.
   

  

**Your role**
 You join a committed, skilled, and friendly team of 25 developers working close to Marketing, Sales and customers. We are responsible for delivering ALTURE – a cloud-based Data Driven Services product suite. ALTURE is about improving efficiency, quality, safety, speed, ergonomics and environmental performance. Together with the team, you develop high-quality software in an agile environment from first idea to final product. You are also part of research and technology innovation initiatives, to ensure that Atlas Copco continues to be the market leader.
   

 Your focus areas:
   

  

* Work in a Microsoft technology stack with development of serverless SaaS products
* Programming in C#/.Net


 We have a committed and multinational R&D department at our head office in Sickla. Our industrial ideas empower customers to grow and drive society forward. This is how we create a better tomorrow.
   

  

**City:** 
 Nacka, Stockholm. We have a hybrid workplace.
   

  

**You will need**
* A technical academic degree, a Master of Science in Software Engineering or significant programming experience.
* A couple of years of experience of C# / .Net programming.
* Experiences from Cloud development, SQL, Cyber security and Azure Devops are good to have.
* You appreciate and deliver high quality, efficient and readable code.
* You are fluent in English and enjoy interacting and collaborating locally and worldwide.


**We offer**
 At Atlas Copco, we have a friendly atmosphere and a culture known for respectful interaction, ethical behavior and integrity. We offer opportunities to grow and develop, as well as potential to see your ideas realized and make an impact. As part of the Atlas Copco Group, you have access to global job opportunities.
   

 Please contact the recruiting manager Jörgen Maass, [email protected] , for more information.
   

 Application: Please send us your CV including information about your expectations on your next job. We are looking forward to your application via our job site!
   

  

**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**
 Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.

title: IT Engineer - Workflow Management System
description:
**Company Description**
 Are you looking for a company that offers a variety of assignments and gives you the chance to work with innovation and new technologies? With us at SEGULA Technologies, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects and help shape the digital domain while being supported towards your dream career. Skills development is a big part of SEGULA Technologies' DNA and we are always looking for new, ingenious and bold talents. Does this sound exciting? Join us on our journey in a fast growing international company.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Back-end Development: Writing and optimizing code for the back-end systems that support Dashworks.
* Operational Troubleshooting and Monitoring: Identifying and resolving technical issues; Monitoring system performance / servers functionality.
* Support Architectural Decisions.
* Deployment of new use cases.
* Analyzing Issues.
* Using the front end to create and manage all aspects of projects – Self service portals, mail outs, capacity slots, etc.
* Maintenance of the back end databases and creation of new connections where necessary – where the SQL knowledge as well as powershell script knowledge is required.
* Liaising with Juriba on the update and maintenance of the server – both the QA and dev server.
* Liaising with projects for requirements.


**Required Skills**
 DEPLOYMENT
   

  

 MIGRATIONS
   

  

 SHELL SCRIPTING
   

  

 MS SQL AZURE
   

  

**Languages**
 English
   

  

 Swedish
   

  

 Minimum Degree Required: Bachelor's Degree
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Very good knowledge on Work Flow Management Tool(s) (Preferably Juriba Dashworks)
   

  

 Very knowledge on SQL
   

  

 Very good knowledge on Powershell and Automation
   

  

 Experience with LCM
   

  

 Experience with monitoring systems and automations
   

  

 Background in enterprise migrations projects
   

  

 ITIL
   

  

**Nice To Have Skills**
* Active Directory
* Entra ID
* Remedy/Helix
* Windows 11
* DBA


**Keywords**
 Education:
   

  

 Bachelor / Master
   

  

 MD-102 / MS-102
   

  

 Powershell
   

  

 SQL
   

  

 ITIL
   

  

**Additional Information**
 Office policy is at least 2-3days per week from the office, and then remote work.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Secure employment and working conditions according to Swedish labor law
* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Work with a collection of SEGULA's valued clients, leading companies in their field
* Be part of a growing network of skilled engineers
* Close relationship with a manager dedicated to you who will support you in your career development
* A choice of networking events at the company with great colleagues


 To thrive in this role we believe that you enjoy working collaboratively and that you are proactive in taking initiative. To apply for this position, you need to have a valid work VISA within the European Union. We embrace diversity and equality and attach great importance to your personal qualities. We are continuesly recruiting, so welcome with you application today!
